title: webhook entry doesnt work

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Telegram, ReST API, external control, ...

body:
* Operating system: OSX
  * Python Version: 3.10
  * CCXT version: 3.0.75
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2023.4
  

## Describe the problem:

Configuration for webhooks doesnt work unless you use the deprecated values such as webhookentry, webhookstatus.

Working config:

```
"webhook": {
    "enabled": true,
    "url": "<Your webhook url>",
    "format": "json",
    "webhookstatus": {
      "status": "{status}"
    }
  }
```

Not working config:

```
"webhook": {
    "enabled": true,
    "url": "<Your webhook url>",
    "format": "json",
    "status": {
      "status": "{status}"
    }
  }

```


### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Add webhook config in your bot and try to consume the messages using the working and not working configuration mentioned above

### Observed Results:

  * Using the deprecated values for webhook configuration works
  * Using the values mentioned in your spec dont work

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

Note: Please copy/paste text of the messages, no screenshots of logs please.

  ```
2023-04-27 15:11:36,858 - freqtrade.rpc.webhook - INFO - Message type 'status' not configured for webhooks
  ```

Problem is in your function here under rpc/webhook.py:
```
 def _get_value_dict(self, msg: RPCSendMsg) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
        whconfig = self._config['webhook']
        # Deprecated 2022.10 - only keep generic method.
        if msg['type'] in [RPCMessageType.ENTRY]:
            valuedict = whconfig.get('webhookentry')
        elif msg['type'] in [RPCMessageType.ENTRY_CANCEL]:
            valuedict = whconfig.get('webhookentrycancel')
        elif msg['type'] in [RPCMessageType.ENTRY_FILL]:
            valuedict = whconfig.get('webhookentryfill')
        elif msg['type'] == RPCMessageType.EXIT:
            valuedict = whconfig.get('webhookexit')
        elif msg['type'] == RPCMessageType.EXIT_FILL:
            valuedict = whconfig.get('webhookexitfill')
        elif msg['type'] == RPCMessageType.EXIT_CANCEL:
            valuedict = whconfig.get('webhookexitcancel')
        elif msg['type'] in (RPCMessageType.STATUS,
                             RPCMessageType.STARTUP,
                             RPCMessageType.EXCEPTION,
                             RPCMessageType.WARNING):
            valuedict = whconfig.get('webhookstatus')
        elif msg['type'].value in whconfig:
            # Allow all types ...
            valuedict = whconfig.get(msg['type'].value)
        elif msg['type'] in (
                RPCMessageType.PROTECTION_TRIGGER,
                RPCMessageType.PROTECTION_TRIGGER_GLOBAL,
                RPCMessageType.WHITELIST,
                RPCMessageType.ANALYZED_DF,
                RPCMessageType.NEW_CANDLE,
                RPCMessageType.STRATEGY_MSG):
            # Don't fail for non-implemented types
            return None
        return valuedict
```
        
As you can see here :
```
if msg['type'] in [RPCMessageType.ENTRY]:
            valuedict = whconfig.get('webhookentry')
```

and given this:

```
class RPCMessageType(str, Enum):
    STATUS = 'status'
    WARNING = 'warning'
    EXCEPTION = 'exception'
    STARTUP = 'startup'

    ENTRY = 'entry'
```

Its never going to work unless you specify webhookentry for example in your config.

title: Bug fix: FreqAI backtest target setting

labels.name: freqAI
labels.description: Issues and PR's related to freqAI

body:
## Bug

This PR fixes a backtesting bug found by @JohanVlugt and @samsam in the FreqAI discord. In brief, setting targets in backtesting does not permit using the `metadata["pair"]` in the column's fstring. 

## Cause 
We remove special chars ( the colon ":") from the dataframe columns before the sub train dataframes are split up and before the final targets are created for each sub train. 

## Fix
Remove the special chars from the sub train dataframes only, and do it *after* the targets are set, but *before* training. (All because LightGBM training doesnt like the special chars).

I try to lock every pair using some condition(not separatly, but for every pair in current whitelist) using this:



        if self.config['runmode'].value in ('live', 'dry_run'):

I also tried to use example from documentation - the same error appears.

if self.config['runmode'].value in ('live', 'dry_run'):
   # fetch closed trades for the last 2 days
    trades = Trade.get_trades([Trade.pair == metadata['pair'],

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 22.04 : docker-2023.3.dev-b710bdaf
  * Python Version:  
  * CCXT version: _____ (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2023.2 (weird... telegrams says another verison)
  
## Describe the problem:

Hi me again. I had an issue last week. 
https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues/8270

Because of the updated CCXT I thought I will try the develop build. Things went fine for two days.
But tonight I got stuck in some sort of locked state. I am trading futures on Gate.io. 

1) The bot couldn't update the stoploss due to " In stop-loss limit order, stop price should be more than limit price". which should always be the case i guess (0.99 ratio set). 
2) The bot couldn't send the error message via telegram "couldn't parse entity" 
3) One of the exceptions cause the bot stop, and I could restart. Thas was unfortunate because I also couldn't force exit the trade.
4) After closing the trades on the exchange I still couldn't restart due to this error. It tried to update the stop-loss.
5) I reseted my .sqlite. Now it is working again.

title: PostgreSQL DB Sessions are not closed properly?
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?
Yes

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)
  * Python Version: Python 3.9.2
  * CCXT version: ccxt==2.8.17
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2023.2
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

Im using Freqtrade with PostgreSQL as database (`--db-url postgresql+psycopg2://db_user:*****@localhost:5432/Hasensachen_FreqAI_07`). The database is running via docker. Freqtrade is running as systemd service. Both are running on the same host.
Everything is running fine except, that after some time freqtrade crashes with the following error:
`raise exc.TimeoutError(sqlalchemy.exc.TimeoutError: QueuePool limit of size 20 overflow 40 reached, connection timed out, timeout 30.00 (Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/14/3o7r)`
When i started using postgresql i was using the default QueuePool of size 5 overflow 10. I have increased it to size 20 overflow 40 by changing the following line https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/a31045874ed51faf22f7672ec4b8823df59fe83a/freqtrade/persistence/models.py#L48
to
`        engine = create_engine(db_url, pool_size=20, max_overflow=40, future=True, **kwargs)`

Unfortunately this does not prevent Freqtrade from crashing but postpones the crash. With the default QueuePool settings it was running fine for a few hours, with the increased sizes it's running around 1 - 2 days before it crashes.

Im running pgAdmin to manage my DB. From there I can clearly see that the database sessions are increasing over time (unfortunately there is no history available). Right now im just near my limit again (60 sessions). The following picture shows what happens after a restart of freqtrade.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74504278/223202930-9aa7050f-7cf1-41b2-ad55-0c9a5ed6cde4.png)
After the restart the sessions are getting reduced to below 10 and then adding up to the limit again.
Below just as an example a few of the open sessions:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74504278/223203479-2b5c10e1-3103-4e0c-834c-c2008333b77d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74504278/223203778-2aa48c49-ec23-4174-b034-0271c8a465e3.png)
(Please excuse the screenshots)

After the restart they are gone. What i experienced is, that they are increasing in real-time when i click around in FreqUI.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Use Freqtrade with postgresql
  2. Leave Freqtrade running for a while
  3. Click around in FreqUI to increase the sessions manually.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

```

  File "/home/myuser/freqtrade/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 3394, in raw_connection

  File "/home/myuser/freqtrade/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 3361, in _wrap_pool_connect

  File "/home/myuser/freqtrade/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/sqlalchemy/pool/base.py", line 327, in connect

sqlalchemy.exc.TimeoutError: QueuePool limit of size 20 overflow 40 reached, connection timed out, timeout 30.00 (Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/14/3o7r)
```

In the attached file `ft_db_error.log` you can see a full run until FT is crashing.
[ft_db_error.log](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/files/10901901/ft_db_error.log)

### Related info

I've found #7364, which shows the same error but it were concluded to be a connection issue. Im pretty sure that there is no connection issue at my side as i can clearly see from the db sessions in pgAdmin that they are increasing over time and the bot crashes, as soon as they are reaching the QueuePool size limit. Also as they are running within the same host. Hardware is also no issue as at the time of the crash as there are plenty of free resources available to the host at the time of the crash.

Thanks a lot for your support!

title: Order {trade.open_order_id} for {trade.pair} not cancelled, as the filled amount of {filled_val} would result in an unexitable trade.

labels.name: unsupported exchange
labels.description: Issues concerning exchanges that are currently unsupported

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS (in VPS)
  * Python Version: Python 3.10.6
  * CCXT version: ccxt==2.7.66
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2023.2.dev-8d156b277 (installed using setup.sh)

## Describe the problem:

- Freqtrade refuses to exit trade and warns user with error: 
```freqtrade.freqtradebot - WARNING - Order {trade.open_order_id} for {trade.pair} not cancelled, as the filled amount of {filled_val} would result in an unexitable trade.```
(I copied this error from `freqtradebot.py`, for sample message, view below).
- The error happens to all crypto pairs using the strategies I mentioned below.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Load any one of the strategies I am using:
  * [strategy-A](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dOYqAHtjoKhNMTyyw-ahyxQ0Lya57CTz/view?usp=sharing)
  * [strategy-B](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zLddrYH2ZpV5AI7j29YLzttAH0_c33cB/view?usp=sharing)
  2. Load the [config I am using](https://drive.google.com/file/d/13T-Mdk3jJmoMxE4cCqDAJj-Il9QukBC8/view?usp=sharing)
  
### Observed Results:

  What happened?
  - `Strategy-A` would enter trades but wouldn't exit any, while producing the error below.
  - `Strategy-B` works but as soon as you turn on trailing stoploss, same error appears.
  
What did you expect to happen?
  1. I expected there was problem with my config (as mentioned). However, using the same config in dry-run: `strategy-A` will produce error but `strategy-B` (with trailing stoploss turn off) will work as expected.
  2. So I suspected the problem to be `strategy-A` itself. However, when I turned on trailing stoploss for `strategy-B` (which normally works), the error happened again.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs
Sample of the logs I got:
  ```
2023-02-26 09:44:09,749 - freqtrade.freqtradebot - INFO - Found open order for Trade(id=2, pair=YFDAI/USDT, amount=0.59450000, is_short=False, leverage=1.0, open_rate=102.08684272, open_since=2023-02-26 06:30:59)
2023-02-26 09:44:09,771 - freqtrade.freqtradebot - WARNING - Order dry_run_sell_1677404478.863213 for YFDAI/USDT not cancelled, as the filled amount of 0.5945 would result in an unexitable trade.
2023-02-26 09:44:09,927 - freqtrade.strategy.interface - WARNING - Outdated history for pair ASTRA/USDT. Last tick is 74 minutes old
  ```
## Additional Info:
- I have only tested these strategies in dry-run using [kucoin proxy](https://github.com/mikekonan/exchange-proxy)
- `Strategy-B` has DCA in it but works fine if you turn off trailing stoploss.
- Problem only happened in `strategy-A` (either with or without DCA), and `strategy-B` if trailing stoploss was turned on.
- I ran both strategies in parallel and with different settings and some worked, other didn't, so I highly doubt if the proxy or config was the culprit.

The problem seemed to be with `minstake` ([as seen in `freqtradebot.py`](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/develop/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py#L1443)).
I have tried to fix with different settings and looked at Freqtrade source code but no clue. Thanks if you have any input.

title: 3.11: "ValueError: 'CandleType' is not a valid CandleType" or "No pair in whitelist."

body:
### Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

Yes.

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Windows 10
  * Python Version: 3.11.0
  * CCXT version: 2.8.17
  * Freqtrade Version: 2023.2.dev-cdc96136b
  
## Describe the problem:

Running `freqtrade backtesting --strategy SampleStrategy --config config.json --data-format-ohlcv hdf5 --timerange 20210101- --enable-position-stacking --enable-protections --pairs BNB/USDT:USDT BTC/USDT:USDT ETH/USDT:USDT CFX/USDT:USDT SOL/USDT:USDT LTC/USDT:USDT DOGE/USDT:USDT XTZ/USDT` gives the error mentioned in the title.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. `freqtrade new-config --config config.json`
  2. `freqtrade create-userdir --userdir user_data`
  3. `config.json` modified. *Relevant* parts:-
```
    "max_open_trades": 4,
    "stake_currency": "USDT",
    "stake_amount": "unlimited",
    "tradable_balance_ratio": 0.8,
    "dry_run": true,
    "dry_run_wallet": 50,
    "cancel_open_orders_on_exit": false,
    "trading_mode": "futures",
    "margin_mode": "isolated",
    "exchange": {
        "name": "binance",
        "ccxt_config": {},
        "ccxt_async_config": {},
        "pair_whitelist": [
        ],
        "pair_blacklist": [
            "BNB/.*"
        ]
    },
    "pairlists": [
        {
            "method": "StaticPairList",
        }
    ],
```
  5. `user_data\sample_strategy.py` modified. *Relevant* parts:-
```
    trailing_stop = True
    timeframe = '1m'
```
  7. `freqtrade download-data --erase --data-format-trades hdf5 --data-format-ohlcv hdf5 --include-inactive-pairs --timerange 20210101- --timeframes 1m --trading-mode futures --pairs BNB/USDT BTC/USDT ETH/USDT CFX/USDT SOL/USDT LTC/USDT DOGE/USDT XTZ/USDT`

  9. `freqtrade backtesting --strategy SampleStrategy --config config.json --data-format-ohlcv hdf5 --timerange 20210101- --enable-position-stacking --enable-protections --pairs BNB/USDT:USDT BTC/USDT:USDT ETH/USDT:USDT CFX/USDT:USDT SOL/USDT:USDT LTC/USDT:USDT DOGE/USDT:USDT XTZ/USDT:USDT` gives "ValueError: 'CandleType' is not a valid CandleType".
  
### Observed Results:

#### What happened?
`freqtrade backtesting --strategy SampleStrategy --config config.json --data-format-ohlcv hdf5 --timerange 20210101- --enable-position-stacking --enable-protections --pairs BNB/USDT BTC/USDT ETH/USDT CFX/USDT SOL/USDT LTC/USDT DOGE/USDT XTZ/USDT` gives "No pair in whitelist" even though the pairs do exist and are active as confirmed by `freqtrade list-pairs --exchange binance --trading-mode futures` and by going onto Binance and looking the pairs up.

`freqtrade backtesting --strategy SampleStrategy --config config.json --data-format-ohlcv hdf5 --timerange 20210101- --enable-position-stacking --enable-protections --pairs BNB/USDT:USDT BTC/USDT:USDT ETH/USDT:USDT CFX/USDT:USDT SOL/USDT:USDT LTC/USDT:USDT DOGE/USDT:USDT XTZ/USDT:USDT` gives "ValueError: 'CandleType' is not a valid CandleType".

Backtesting..?

title: Memory leak when using ReinforcementLearner_multiproc. Endless Python processes generation.

labels.name: freqAI
labels.description: Issues and PR's related to freqAI

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Linux Mint 21.1
  * Python Version: 3.10.10(`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: 2.8.17 (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: docker-2023.2.dev-e56bf067 (`freqtrade -V` or `docker compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

When using the _**ReinforcementLearner_multiproc.py**_ model, over time, a large number of Python instances are launched, which are closed only if the container is stopped or manually killed.

### Steps to reproduce:

1. Start container using appropriate config and strategy using **_ReinforcementLearner_multiproc_**
2. Open System Monitor.
3. Watch how Python instances are created when training starts, but not deleted when it ends.
  
### Observed Results:

When training starts for a particular ticker, a large number of Python instances are added, as expected.
When the training of the next ticker starts, new Python instances are added additionally, while the old ones are not deleted, although they show 0% CPU load.
In my opinion, Python instances should be deleted after training is complete, before new ones are added.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

I was able to fix the issue on my setup by adding the following lines of code to the **_set_train_and_eval_environment_** method of the **_ReinforcementLearner_multiproc_** class, before the functions that create the training environments.


```
if self.train_env :
    self.train_env.close()
if self.eval_env :
    self.eval_env.close()
```

title: Can't use journald because systemd python package is outdated
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Arch Linux
  * Python Version:  3.10.0
  * CCXT version: 2.7.12
  * Freqtrade Version: 2023.1

## Describe the problem:
Using `--logifle journald` after installing systemd python package as stated in [manual](https://www.freqtrade.io/en/stable/advanced-setup/#logging-to-journald) will produce python error.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Install systemd python package `pip install systemd`
  2. Run the bot `freqtrade trade --logfile journald`
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened? Bot throw error and stop working. systemd python package version is old and only works with python 3.6. The new package by same author has  renamed as `cysystemd`.
  * What did you expect to happen? Bot will run without error while sending log to journald.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs
```

title: Kucoin passord should be a string also if it is passed with an environment variable
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: docker
  * Python Version: _____ (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: _____ (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: develop
  
## Describe the problem:

When you use docker version of freqtrade and you want to pass kucoin password with an environment variable, it is converted in number but validator says that it should be a string

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. prepare docker environment
  2. configure to use real kucoin account
  3. pass kucoin password as environment variable
  
### Observed Results:

Validator refuse to accept configuration because kucoin password should be a string and not a numeric value

  * Python Version: 2.7.1.6
  * CCXT version: 2.6.65

## Describe the problem:

Using any strategy in consumer/producer mode that requires the calling of dataframe.iloc will generate an error on the producer side.
dataframe.iloc requires an integer, but is being passed as a float.

title: (Futures) Trades are not executed during backtesting when the `stake_amount` is too low

labels.name: Backtest
labels.description: Issues related backtesting.

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Linux
  * Python Version: 3.10
  * CCXT version: 2.5.39
  * Freqtrade Version: develop branch
  
## Describe the problem:

In backtesting, when the stake amount is adjusted to the minimum stake amount, the trade is not entered because of strict inequality test `>` instead of non-strict test `>=` , here:

https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/020dc3c6e13baaedd43715126ec689d878b35a53/freqtrade/optimize/backtesting.py#L803



### Steps to reproduce:

Run a backtesting with a low `stake_amount` configuration for a bot trading on futures.
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
    No trade is executed
  * What did you expect to happen?
   Trades with adjusted `stake_amount` should be exectuted.

title: Funding fee explodes with --timeframe-detail option

labels.name: Backtest
labels.description: Issues related backtesting.

labels.name: Non-spot
labels.description: Non-spot (margin, leverage, futures) related issues and Pull requests

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: linux
  * Python Version: 3.10 
  * CCXT version: 1.93.66 
  * Freqtrade Version: 2012.12 
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

The trade's funding fee is miscalculated in back-testing when trade adjustment is enabled and --timeframe-detail option is used.

The assumption made here:
https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/8e5b4750d64c265c138f14f420d79c39627afa75/freqtrade/persistence/trade_model.py#L204


doesn't hold true when using --timeframe-detail because `is_first` is not always True here:
https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/8e5b4750d64c265c138f14f420d79c39627afa75/freqtrade/optimize/backtesting.py#L699

This results in wrong calculation of the funding fees and produces overflow in trades with many adjustments.

    def populate_entry_trend(self, dataframe: DataFrame, metadata: dict) -> DataFrame:

        :param dataframe: DataFrame
        :param metadata: Additional information, like the currently traded pair
        :return: DataFrame with entry columns populated
        """
        dataframe.loc[
            (
                (qtpylib.crossed(dataframe['rsi'], self.buy_rsi.value, "above")) &
                (dataframe['volume'] > 0)  # Make sure Volume is not 0
            ),
            'enter_long'] = 1

            (
                (qtpylib.crossed_above(dataframe['rsi'], self.sell_rsi.value)) &  # Signal: RSI crosses above sell_rsi

                (dataframe['tema'] < dataframe['tema'].shift(1)) &  # Guard: tema is falling
                (dataframe['volume'] > 0)  # Make sure Volume is not 0
            ),
            'enter_short'] = 1
        """

        return dataframe

        :param dataframe: DataFrame
        :param metadata: Additional information, like the currently traded pair
        :return: DataFrame with exit columns populated
        """

        dataframe.loc[
            (
                # Signal: RSI crosses above sell_rsi
                # Signal: RSI crosses above sell_rsi
                (qtpylib.crossed(dataframe['rsi'], self.sell_rsi.value, "below")) &
                (dataframe['tema'] < dataframe['tema'].shift(1)) &  # Guard: tema is falling
                (dataframe['volume'] > 0)  # Make sure Volume is not 0
            ),
            'exit_long'] = 1
        # Uncomment to use shorts (Only used in futures/margin mode. Check the documentation for more info)
        """
        dataframe.loc[
            (
                (qtpylib.crossed_above(dataframe['rsi'], self.buy_rsi.value)) &  # Signal: RSI crosses above buy_rsi
                (dataframe['tema'] <= dataframe['bb_middleband']) &  # Guard: tema below BB middle
                (dataframe['tema'] > dataframe['tema'].shift(1)) &  # Guard: tema is raising
                (dataframe['volume'] > 0)  # Make sure Volume is not 0
            ),
            'exit_short'] = 1
        """
        return dataframe

### Observed Results:

  * What happened?

title: CooldownPeriod doesn't work for trade with negative profit
body: ## Describe your environment * Operating system: Windows 11 * Python Version: 3.10.7 * Freqtrade Version: 2022.10.dev-107845afa ## Your question I'm trying to use `CooldownPeriod` to prevent creating a trade for a pair that just exited with negative profit, like this: ``` @property def protections(self): return [ { "method": "CooldownPeriod", "stop_duration": 30 } ] ``` But for some reason, protection is only triggered for trade which exited with positive profit. Did I misunderstand how it works or it some bug?

body:
Describe your environment
Operating system: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS
Python Version: 3.10.6
Freqtrade 2022.6
CCXT 1.89.14
Freqtrade running in docker : docker-compose up -d --remove-orphans
Echange: Binance

Hello everyone, i know this error is not new, but I can't understand the logic behind.
part from my strategy file:

    position_adjustment_enable = True

    stoploss = -0.33

        'entry': 'market',
        'exit': 'market',

When it tries to cancel a stop loss order it throws this error, but despite the error (when you click on the link in the error it will open {"code":-2014,"msg":"API-key format invalid."} message in browser), it does fine what he has to do (cancel the old SL order and put a new one width current stake), I have checked all my SL orders in Binance App.
It's happening ONLY when canceling SL orders, **after new DCA buy's**, to adjust SL for the new stake. Every time a DCA order is filled. 
All other functions/task's are working fine, no other error, so I don't see a API connection problem here.

Even when a SL order cancel after ROI exit is happen, no error is thrown (see example).

title: Errors on _rpc_trade_status after orders on Kucoin

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Telegram, ReST API, external control, ...

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: `Ubuntu 22.04`
  * Python Version: `3.10.6`
  * CCXT version: `ccxt==2.1.82`
  * Freqtrade Version: `2022.11.dev-9ee478ade`
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

Hi. I have been running a new install of Freqtrade a couple days ago, using the `develop` branch.
Just after doing a `forcebuy (market order)` (also happened with a `forcesell (market order)` later on), I immediately started getting HTTP 500 errors on `/status` when looking at requests made by FreqUI on my browser. FreqUI gets stuck, displaying the bot as unreacheable with the red dot on the header.

Please note that this issue happens with bots using the `Kucoin` exchange.

```
2022-11-16 22:17:20,874 - uvicorn.access - INFO - 127.0.0.1:33776 - "GET /api/v1/status HTTP/1.0" 500
2022-11-16 22:17:20,898 - uvicorn.error - ERROR - Exception in ASGI application
Traceback (most recent call last):
[...]
  File "/home/ubuntu/freqtrade/freqtrade/rpc/api_server/api_v1.py", line 97, in status
    return rpc._rpc_trade_status()
  File "/home/ubuntu/freqtrade/freqtrade/rpc/rpc.py", line 221, in _rpc_trade_status
    open_order='({} {} rem={:.8f})'.format(
TypeError: unsupported format string passed to NoneType.__format__
```

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Run a Freqtrade bot on the `develop` branch using `Kucoin` exchange.
  2. Execute a forcebuy (market order) while having FreqUI running.
  3. Having Freqtrade logs at `info` level, stacktrace of `NoneType` errors can be seen, HTTP 500 `/status` requests, while FreqUI is stuck.
  
### Observed Results:

Please note that these errors are likely to still happen for some time even after restarting Freqtrade, when getting HTTP 429 (rate limit) from Kucoin (happens quite often with this exchange). So orders might not be fetched and updated right away, causing the issue to keep happening.

It seems to be happening since the following commit https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/commit/7c84edbc23cb9018f423c095336bdb70938447c0, and originally caused by `ccxt` when calling Kucoin API:
An issue opened on `ccxt` library GH regarding "Kucoin Spot Market Orders" raises the fact that the `Order` object may have some of his fields as `None` when creating a market order, because they are missing from Kucoin API response: https://github.com/ccxt/ccxt/issues/14634

One of the maintainers of `ccxt` suggests to use ccxt's `fetchOrder` to get the data afterwards and have the fully updated order. This is actually what was done on commit https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/commit/7c84edbc23cb9018f423c095336bdb70938447c0 before, thus updating the order when calling `/status`.

Reverting the commit and starting the bot fixes the issue as soon as `/status` gets called by FreqUI.

Thank you for your help.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

Pasting the full stacktrace here:

```

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Windows 10
  * Python Version: 3.10.4 
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.9.1
  

## Describe the problem:

I am using a Freqai strategy. with same configuration and same strategy, I am back-testing two timeperiods. 
1) 2022-09-07 to 2022-09-23 - result is 5.35% profit. Note down the weekly breakdown. Week 11/09: 4.816, 18/09: 15.542
2) 2022-09-07 to 2022-09-29 - result is -2.53%. The inconsistency is in the weekly breakdown. Week 11/09: -6.259, 18/09: 6.99

As you can see only the last week should have different result as config and strategy is same. But all weeks have different results. Refer attached screenshots for weekly breakdown and results.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58465165/198883315-abd9b880-db36-40cc-a494-2887624931b7.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58465165/198883364-042d19ef-bddb-47b8-aecf-0f8960ae1883.png)

Request to have a look and resolve this issue. Thank you.
### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create freqtrade config and strategy with 1 hours timeframe.
  2. Backtest the strategy with 3 weeks time.
  3. Backtest with the same time period + one more week i.e 4 weeks.

title: Backtest incorrectly processes timed out orders

labels.name: Backtest
labels.description: Issues related backtesting.

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Windows 10
  * Python Version: 3.10.8 
  * CCXT version: 1.93.98
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.9.1

## Describe the problem:

I wrote a simple strategy that places limit orders every candle. Price calculations are based on previous candles (such indicators as ATR, Supertrend, nPOC, etc.) So the basic idea is to place a long order below the current price and wait for it to be filled. If it doesn't fill during the current candle then cancel it. On new candle make recalculations and place a new order. Strategy uses 1 pair and opens max 1 trade.
During backtesting I noticed that orders were placed every two candles, so some orders were skipped. This issue doesn't depend on the timeframe.

### Steps to reproduce:

test_strategy.py:
```
import logging
from datetime import datetime
from functools import reduce
from typing import Optional

from pandas import DataFrame

from freqtrade.strategy import (IStrategy)

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)


class TestStrategy(IStrategy):

    startup_candle_count = 10
    stoploss = -0.03
    minimal_roi = {"0": 100}
    can_short: bool = False

    def populate_indicators(self, dataframe: DataFrame, metadata: dict) -> DataFrame:
        return dataframe

    def populate_entry_trend(self, dataframe: DataFrame, metadata: dict) -> DataFrame:
        long_conditions = [dataframe['volume'] > 0]
        if long_conditions:
            dataframe.loc[
                reduce(lambda x, y: x & y, long_conditions),
                'enter_long'] = 1

        return dataframe

    def populate_exit_trend(self, dataframe: DataFrame, metadata: dict) -> DataFrame:
        return dataframe

    def custom_entry_price(self, pair: str, current_time: datetime, proposed_rate: float,
                           entry_tag: Optional[str], side: str, **kwargs) -> float:
        message = f'>>> ENTRY >>> time: {current_time}'
        logger.info(message)
        return 1000.0
```

test-config.json:
```
{
  "dry_run": true,
  "initial_state": "running",
  "trading_mode": "futures",
  "margin_mode": "isolated",
  "futures_funding_rate": 0.0,
  "process_only_new_candles": true,
  "max_open_trades": 1,
  "stake_currency": "USDT",
  "stake_amount": "unlimited",
  "tradable_balance_ratio": 0.99,
  "fiat_display_currency": "USD",
  "stoploss": -0.03,
  "timeframe": "1m",
  "order_types": {
    "entry": "limit",
    "exit": "limit",
    "stoploss": "market",
    "stoploss_on_exchange": false
  },
  "ignore_buying_expired_candle_after": 10,
  "unfilledtimeout": {
    "entry": 50,
    "exit": 50,
    "unit": "seconds"
  },
  "exchange": {
    "name": "okx",
    "pair_whitelist": [
      "BTC/USDT:USDT"
    ]
  },
  "entry_pricing": {
    "use_order_book": true,
    "order_book_top": 1,
    "price_side": "other",
    "price_last_balance": 0.0,
    "check_depth_of_market": {
      "enabled": false,
      "bids_to_ask_delta": 1
    }
  },
  "exit_pricing": {
    "use_order_book": true,
    "order_book_top": 1,
    "price_side": "other"
  },
  "pairlists": [
    {
      "method": "StaticPairList"
    }
  ]
}
```

backtest command:
`freqtrade backtesting -c ./user_data/test-config.json --strategy TestStrategy -p BTC/USDT:USDT --timeframe 1m --timerange=20221013-`
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
 Strategy uses 1m timeframe. Look at the orders time, they were placed every 2 minutes instead of 1.
```
test_strategy - INFO - >>> ENTRY >>> time: 2022-10-13 07:09:00+00:00
test_strategy - INFO - >>> ENTRY >>> time: 2022-10-13 07:11:00+00:00
test_strategy - INFO - >>> ENTRY >>> time: 2022-10-13 07:13:00+00:00
```

  * What did you expect to happen?
```
test_strategy - INFO - >>> ENTRY >>> time: 2022-10-13 07:09:00+00:00
test_strategy - INFO - >>> ENTRY >>> time: 2022-10-13 07:10:00+00:00
test_strategy - INFO - >>> ENTRY >>> time: 2022-10-13 07:11:00+00:00
test_strategy - INFO - >>> ENTRY >>> time: 2022-10-13 07:12:00+00:00
test_strategy - INFO - >>> ENTRY >>> time: 2022-10-13 07:13:00+00:00
```

### Results
In trade mode everything works fine, so I started to debug backtesting and found the reason of such behavior. When the backtest cancels the order, it [only decrement the open_trade_count](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/develop/freqtrade/optimize/backtesting.py#L1126), but later uses [open_trade_count_start to check for available trading slots](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/develop/freqtrade/optimize/backtesting.py#L1138). As a result, it always gets one slot less than actually available (zero in my case). 
I just added `open_trade_count_start -= 1` to the _Close trade_ block (after line 1126) and now it works as expected. All tests passed successfully and I wrote another test for the described case.

Please check everything I wrote in this bug report. And if this is really a bug, then I have a ready-to-commit code with a fix and a test:)

title: max_open_trades Does not work when we use forceenter

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Telegram, ReST API, external control, ...

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: MacOS 12.5.1
  * Python Version: 3.10.6
  * CCXT version: 1.92.52
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.8
  * dry run : True
  
## Describe the problem:

I send my own signals to freqtrade to make trades, using forceexit and forceenter. If this calls are made simultaneously, freqtrade takes all the trades  even if the count is grater than max_open_trades.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. set max_open_trades=3 and start the bot
  2. call forceenter simultaneously 10 times. 
  3. all trades will be taken
  
### Observed Results:

  * forceenter takes trades irrespective of max_open_trades
  * if new forceenter call comes, freqtrade should skip/through error if the count exceeds max_open_trades

  * When ran live it will through error if the there is no money in wallet after max_open_trade is completed. But I think this needs to be handled in the dry run as well (not tested this scenario).

title: OKX futures - Remaining balance after position exit

labels.name: Non-spot
labels.description: Non-spot (margin, leverage, futures) related issues and Pull requests

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 22.04 (with the freqtrade docker image)
  * Freqtrade Version (docker-compose) : 2022.8

## Describe the problem:
 
The bot opens a short position on `BTC/USDT:USDT` for **1.17** contracts and the bot only sells **1.15** contracts. With **No** use of `adjust_trade_position()`.
**0.02** contracts remain open on the OKX exchange UI. The bot can't open a new "proper" position with the right sizing on this pair after that. 

Not sure how the bot handles the things after that (I saw bad sizing positions and insta-liquidation on same candle on the same pair).

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Open a short or long position on `BTC/USDT:USDT` on perpetual swap futures with an entry signal.
  2. Close the position with an exit signal.
  * Please note this bug doesn't happen on each exit, only sometimes. But often enough to break the normal behavior of the bot.
  
### Observed Results:

  * Sometimes, there is not the same amount of contracts when closing, and the bot can't work properly anymore.
  * The difference in contracts is still visible on OKX (see screenshots attached).
  * You have to manually close de remaining position on OKX to clear everything. After that everything works as excepted again.

title: Range Stability filter: Pairs under the minimum range are accepted when setting both minimum and maximum ranges

labels.name: Pairlist
labels.description: Issues / PR's related to Pairlists / pairlist handling

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Windows
  * Python Version:  3.8.10
  * CCXT version: 1.93.66(`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version:  freqtrade 2022.9.dev-0c01b23cb (Last update)
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

When setting both minimum and maximum ranges, the maximum range is the second checked and overwrites the result of the minimum range result.

### Steps to reproduce:

It is easily seen in the code of rangestabilityfilter.py. From the current file in github, lines 108 to 118 read:

```
if pct_change >= self._min_rate_of_change:
    result = True
else:
    self.log_once(f"Removed {pair} from whitelist, because rate of change "
                  f"over {self._days} {plural(self._days, 'day')} is {pct_change:.3f}, "
                  f"which is below the threshold of {self._min_rate_of_change}.",
                  logger.info)
    result = False
if self._max_rate_of_change:
    if pct_change <= self._max_rate_of_change:
        result = True
```

This last 'result = True' overwrites the False that could have been obtained before, if the pair has a rate change under the minimum.

### Observed Results:

As a result, pairs with stability range under the minimum are accepted.

title: Wrong stake amount after partial sell if canceled on exchange while only partly-filled

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Telegram, ReST API, external control, ...

body:
## Describe your environment * Operating system: Debian "buster" 11.5 * Python Version: 3.9.2 * CCXT version: 1.93.66 (may not be correct! I updated freqtrade before filing this issue) * Freqtrade Version: `develop` branch, git commit 93cbfc5f294afc4e89e73d0161d024bf07ad6cf3 (this bit IS correct) ## Describe the problem: After a series of actions that seemed normal to me at first, I ended up with a trade that freqtrade could not sell, because it thought it was supposed to sell a larger stake than it actually had. In the name of privacy, the name and quantities of the coin in question have been obfuscated, this being a public venue and all. That said, the stake amounts involved were well in excess of the exchange's minimum limits, so that isn't the cause. To start off, the strategy bought 200 COIN through its normal process, i.e. just going about its usual business of buying and selling. It held onto this trade for about a day before I stuck my nose in. :stuck_out_tongue: I decided I needed some money for something else, so I did a partial sell of 50 COIN. The partial sell filled normally, and generated "exiting" and "exited" notifications in Telegram, as usual. This partial sell left 150 COIN, exactly as expected. Immediately after, I realized I needed a bit more money for that other thing, so I did another partial sell of 50 COIN. The bot generated an "exiting" notification for this action, as well. That order was taking forever to fill, but it did get far enough along to meet my immediate need, so I canceled the order via the exchange with 10 COIN left to go, leaving the trade with a final stake of 110 COIN. Canceling the order there caused freqtrade to issue a "canceled" notification, just expected, but the partial sell action itself \*did not\* generate the "exited" notification like with the first partial sell. I didn't initially notice this, though (not until later, when I skimmed through Telegram in pursuit of this issue). Later, when I saw that COIN was just coming to the end of a nice pump, I knew the strategy would probably miss the optimal exit, so I took profit and tried to close-out that trade entirely. That was with a routine force exit, not a partial sell, same as any other day. That should have issued a sell order for 110 COIN, but the bot did not generate an "exiting" notification, which prompted me to check the log. Therein, I saw that the bot was trying to sell *150* COIN, i.e. the amount that remained after the first partial sell filled, thus it was unable to close the trade: ``` 2022-09-19 00:24:09,298 - freqtrade.freqtradebot - INFO - Exit for COIN/XYZ detected. Reason: custom_exit 2022-09-19 00:24:09,519 - freqtrade.wallets - INFO - Wallets synced. 2022-09-19 00:24:09,519 - freqtrade.freqtradebot - WARNING - Unable to exit trade COIN/XYZ: Not enough amount to exit trade. Trade-amount: 150, Wallet: 110 2022-09-19 00:24:18,822 - freqtrade.worker - INFO - Bot heartbeat. PID=305215, version='2022.9.dev-93cbfc5f2, strategy_version: v11.2.140', state='RUNNING' ``` I did a `reload_config` to try to prod the bot to correct the stake amount and close the trade, but that didn't help. I had to delete the trade entirely and sell it via the exchange. There were no rebuys on this particular trade. Just the initial buy and the above-described sells. ### Steps to reproduce: I am not sure if this is repeatable.... 1. Buy something, preferably some low-volume coin that takes a long time to fill. 2. Hold it for a while, maybe even just 5 minutes. 3. Do a partial sell via frequi. 4. Do another partial sell via frequi. 5. Go on the exchange and cancel that order *before* it can completely fill. 6. Hold the remainder for a while, say another 5 minutes. 7. Do a final force-exit via frequi. ### Observed Results: * What happened? * What did you expect to happen? The bot lost track of how much it could actually sell, and thus could not close-out the trade. Obviously, it should have tracked the amount properly at all times :smiley:, but perhaps as a backup, it should automatically use the amount the exchange wallet actually has in it, if that's less than the assumed stake amount. ### Relevant code exceptions or logs Just before the bot went down for the aforementioned restart, it threw this python error:
First python error... ``` 2022-09-18 23:29:05,628 - uvicorn.error - ERROR - Exception in ASGI application Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/uvicorn/protocols/http/h11_impl.py", line 404, in run_asgi result = await app( # type: ignore[func-returns-value] File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/uvicorn/middleware/proxy_headers.py", line 78, in __call__ return await self.app(scope, receive, send) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/uvicorn/middleware/message_logger.py", line 86, in __call__ raise exc from None File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/uvicorn/middleware/message_logger.py", line 82, in __call__ await self.app(scope, inner_receive, inner_send) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/fastapi/applications.py", line 269, in __call__ await super().__call__(scope, receive, send) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/starlette/applications.py", line 124, in __call__ await self.middleware_stack(scope, receive, send) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/starlette/middleware/errors.py", line 184, in __call__ raise exc File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/starlette/middleware/cors.py", line 92, in __call__ await self.simple_response(scope, receive, send, request_headers=headers) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/starlette/middleware/cors.py", line 147, in simple_response await self.app(scope, receive, send) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/starlette/exceptions.py", line 93, in __call__ raise exc File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/.env/lib/python3.9/site-packages/starlette/exceptions.py", line 82, in __call__ await self.app(scope, receive, sender) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/freqtrade/rpc/rpc.py", line 733, in _rpc_force_exit self.__exec_force_exit(trade, ordertype, amount) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/freqtrade/rpc/rpc.py", line 702, in __exec_force_exit self._freqtrade.execute_trade_exit( File self._format_exit_msg(msg) File "/home/vanessa/freqtrade-related/freqtrade-spot/freqtrade/rpc/telegram.py", line 355, in _format_exit_msg message += (f"*Current Rate:* `{msg['current_rate']:.8f}`\n" TypeError: unsupported format string passed to NoneType.__format__ ```
Digging through the logs as requested, I found nothing that suggested a fault with opening either of the sell orders, but the bot did keep repeating the aforementioned stake amount vs. wallet warning every so often. In the midst of those repeated warnings, I found this python error:

I found nothing else in the log that suggested there was a problem.

title: custom_stoploss is not updated at next "stoploss_on_exchange_interval"

labels.name: Stoploss
labels.description: Related to stoploss

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

 * Operating system: MacOS Monterey 12.5.1
 * Python Version: 3.8.5
 * CCXT version: 1.92.20
 * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2022.8 stable

## Describe the problem:

I'm using `custom_stoploss` and set `process_only_new_candles = False`,

```bash
    "stoploss_on_exchange": true,
    "stoploss_on_exchange_interval": 60
```

but when a new trade is placed, the stoploss order is calculated on stoploss, not on `custom_stoploss`, it  updates to the `custom_stoploss` until new candle comes in. (Of course the `custom_stoploss` is smaller than hard stoploss)

I think bots should create a stoploss order based on the `custom_stoploss` just at next loop or next `stoploss_on_exchange_interval`, instead of when new candle comes in.

### Steps to reproduce:

Any strategy can be used to reproduce this case. Actually, from what I remember, before version 2022.8 stable, maybe 2 or 3 month ago, bots put `custom_stoploss`  order on exchange immediately or at `stoploss_on_exchange_interval`, it behaviors as expected. So I guess this bug is introduced in the recent version, may you could compare related codes with 2022.6 stable or 2022.7 stable to find reasons quickly.

title: Wrong value parsed as amount parameter in confirm_trade_entry callback during backtesting.

labels.name: Backtest
labels.description: Issues related backtesting.

body:
* Operating system: Ubuntu 18.04
  * Python Version: 3.9.13 (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: 2022.8 (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.8 (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  

##  Problem:

When backtesting the stake amount is passed as value for the 'amount' parameter in the 'confirm_trade_entry' callback.
The correct value (as per the docs) should be the target amount.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

In backtesting.py:
  ```
            if not strategy_safe_wrapper(self.strategy.confirm_trade_entry, default_retval=True)(
                    pair=pair, order_type=order_type, amount=stake_amount, rate=propose_rate,
                    time_in_force=time_in_force, current_time=current_time,
                    entry_tag=entry_tag, side=direction):
                return trade
  ```

title: Fixed a bug that prevents clearing old models

labels.name: freqAI
labels.description: Issues and PR's related to freqAI

body:
<!-- Thank you for sending your pull request. But first, have you included
unit tests, and is your code PEP8 conformant? [More details](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md)
-->
## Summary

<!-- Explain in one sentence the goal of this PR -->
Fix the issue of purging old models when the "user_data/models/unique-id" directory contains sub-directories with names that do not match a regular expression "sub-train-(\w+)_(\d{10})".
For example, "user_data/models/unique-id/tensorboard".

Solve the issue: #___

## Quick changelog

- Old models are purged correctly if the model dir contains dirs with names that do not match the regex

title: Entry message does not show amount when it is okx.

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Telegram, ReST API, external control, ...

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: win11
  * Python Version: python 3.10 (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: 1.92.84 (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.9.dev-0a6240c (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:
When freqtrade enters an order, the amount is 0.00000000. But when it exits an order, it shows the amount.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. run freqtrade
  2. enter an order
  3. exit an order
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?

```
🔵 Okx (dry): Short ENS/USDT:USDT (#12)
Amount: 0.00000000
Open Rate: 13.80000000
Current Rate: 13.80000000
Total: (100 USDT, 100.1 USD)
```


```
🚀 Okx (dry): Exited ENS/USDT:USDT (#2)
Profit: 6.03% (profit: 60.24829432 USDT / 60.309 USD)
Enter Tag: None
Exit Reason: roi
Direction: Short
Amount: 67.90000000
Open Rate: 14.72000000
Exit Rate: 13.82000000
Duration: 14:11:32 (851.5 min)
```
  * What did you expect to happen?
  It can show amount when extering an order.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

title: Partial_sell not executed properly causing many tries ending up in emergency exit
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 20.04
  * Python Version: Default from latest stable docker image (3.9? freqtrade 2022.8 - stable ) (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: Default from latest stable docker image (freqtrade 2022.8 - stable) (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.8 stable (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

While dry-running a bot on OKX which is using partial-exit: the moment when a partial exit happens, telegram gives this error, and keeps on repeating it at least 100 times:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65864740/188578290-a70dabc6-22fc-47c1-b3c6-531ff6e1f747.png)
See the logging from freqtrade below:

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. create a strategy with partial sell; see my relevant code below
  2. let it dry-run.
  3. when a partial sell event happens I get this error. It can take 15 repeats of this error or even ~300 times before it stops and apparently the order is executed by an "emergency_exit". Does happen on every partial exit that needs to be executed.
  4. 
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened: Order gets cancelled on exchange from 10s to 100s of times until it exits by an emergency_exit
  * What did you expect to happen? Partial_exit gets filled and executed for the first part, somewhat later the second partial_exit will be filled and executed and so on up till 3 parial_exits and the last part on ROI or another exit reason

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

Note: Please copy/paste text of the messages, no screenshots of logs please.

my relevant code:

    def adjust_trade_position(self, trade: Trade, current_time: datetime,
                              current_rate: float, current_profit: float,

                              **kwargs) -> float:
        """
        Custom trade adjustment logic, returning the stake amount that a trade should be
        increased or decreased.
        This means extra buy or sell orders with additional fees.
        Only called when `position_adjustment_enable` is set to True.

        """

        if current_profit > (self.sell_0.value/100) and trade.nr_of_successful_exits == 0:
            # Take half of the profit at +0.6%
            return -(trade.stake_amount / 4)

        if current_profit > (self.sell_1.value/100) and trade.nr_of_successful_exits == 1:
            # Take half of the profit at +1%
            return -(trade.stake_amount / 4)

        if current_profit > (self.sell_2.value/100) and trade.nr_of_successful_exits == 2:
            # Take half of the profit at +4%

title: Certain dry-run trades are exiting because of liquidation

labels.name: Non-spot

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Docker
  * Python Version: 3.10
  * CCXT version: 1.92.52
  * Freqtrade Version: docker-a6d78a86

## Describe the problem:

When dry-running my strategy, when I run it with 4x or 5x leverage and stoploss 0.15, every SHIB/USDT:USDT order gets liquidated. Other pairs work fine. SHIB/USDT:USDT also works fine without leverage. I'm not expecting liquidations. I think they should never happen in this case, because stoploss is <1. My max_open_trades is 5, my stake_amount is 200.  I have a custom_stoploss function. I've (for this test) limited my whitelist to only SHIB/USDT:USDT. 

SHIB/USDT:USDT has a very low price. Compaired to other pairs that I had in my whitelist, the price of SHIB/USDT:USDT is ~100x lower compared to the pair with the second lowest price. Might be related.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create a strategy with leverage. I don't think the strategy itself matters. Maybe it needs to have a custom_stoploss.
  2. Make sure it will buy SHIB with leverage. 
  3. Dry-run, wait for an entry, and watch it get liquidated

  * I'd expect No liquidations

title: adjust_trade_position() is not called correctly when use both DCA and partial exit function in backtesting mode
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

 * Operating system: MacOS Monterey 12.5.1
 * Python Version: 3.8.5
 * CCXT version: 1.92.20
 * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2022.8.dev

## Describe the problem:

The document says "Additional Buys are ignored once you have reached the maximum amount of extra buys that you have set on `max_entry_position_adjustment`, but the callback is called anyway looking for partial exits." 

However, in backtesting mode, `adjust_trade_position()` is not called anymore after the `max_entry_position_adjustment` reaches its limit.

### Steps to reproduce:

- set `"position_adjustment_enable": true, "max_entry_position_adjustment": 2`
- after 2 addition buy orders, `adjust_trade_position()` is not called anymore, so the following partial exit won't work

I guess no necessary to paste config and strategy here, any simple strategy can be used to reproduce this case.

Funding fees are calculated wrong.

### Steps to reproduce:

- use x10 leverage in my futures trading strategy
- run `freqtrade backtesting -c config_initial.json --strategy DOT_SuperATR_10m --timerange 20220709-20220715`

The strategy timeframe is 5m, but bots trade in 10m by resampling data, also use 30m data as informative pairs. I just tested one DOT/USDT future trade and calculated funding fees manually.

The above are trades in backtesting json file:
- Total sell stake is `1399.7 * 7.144 = 9999.46`

- Total buy stake is `69.9 * 6.933 + 199.4 * 6.796 + 56.5 * 6.827 + 268.4 * 6.613 + 281.9 * 6.523 + 52.3 * 6.548 + 70.6 * 6.1 + 400.7 * 6.536 = 9231.32`

- The total profit ratio is `760.99 / 10000 = 7.61%`

All `funding fee rates` were negative over this short trade, for calculating the **max** `funding fees`, let's say bot didn't decrease position until it's closed, and use the open price for calculation, so I just calculated manually the `funding fees` is 27.45, not 65.34, there must be some calculation mistake when funding rates are applied to the trade object.

title: Calculation problems while using partial exit in `adjust_trade_position`

labels.name: Backtest
labels.description: Issues related backtesting.

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## My environment

  * Operating system: MacOS Monterey 12.5.1
  * Python Version: 3.8.5
  * CCXT version: 1.92.20
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2022.8.dev
 
## Describe the problem:

I guess we've got a calculation bug in backtesting mode while using partial exit in `adjust_trade_position`, `profit_ratio, profit_abs, stake_amount, amount` in backtesting trade results is wrong, and `Absolute profit, Total profit %` in  SUMMARY METRICS is wrong too.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. set `"stake_amount": 1000, "dry_run_wallet": 10000, "tradable_balance_ratio": 0.99,` in the config file
  2. use x10 leverage in my futures trading strategy
  3. run `freqtrade backtesting -c config_initial.json --strategy DOT_SuperATR_10m --timerange 20220709-20220715`

The strategy timeframe is 5m, but bots trade in 10m by resampling data.  

### Observed Results:

In the backtesting trade results, only one short trade with 1 time entry and 4 times exit. Here is the point:

  * short entry 10000u at 7.138
  * exit 500u at 6.827
  * exit 1000u at 6.548
  * exit 1500u at 6.1
  * exit all at 6.536 (it is 928.9 * 6.536 = 6071.29u)

So, the total profits is `10000 - (500 + 1000 + 1500 + 6071.29) = 928.7`, profit ratio is `928.7 / 10000 = 9.287%`. But why it shows this in the backtesting trade results? 
```python
"stake_amount": 663.12479124,
"amount": 928.9,
```
the `stake_amount` should be `1000`, and bot use x10 leverage, the `amount` should be `1000 * 10 / 7.1385 = 1400.8`, like the first sell order in orders list shows:

```python
"orders": [
  {
    "amount": 1400.8,
    "safe_price": 7.1385000000000005,
    "ft_order_side": "sell",
    "order_filled_timestamp": 1657414800000,
    "ft_is_entry": true
  },
```

Also, the `profit_ratio` and `profit_abs` should be wrong. It shows below:
```python
"profit_ratio": 0.8456669642586091,
"profit_abs": 535.80607829,
```

And, the `SUMMARY METRICS` shows total profit is `535.8 / 10000 = 5.36%` is wrong too. I rely on these metrics to optimize the strategy, could you please fix this, make it shows more accurately.

```python
| Starting balance            | 10000 USDT                |
| Final balance               | 10535.806 USDT            |
| Absolute profit             | 535.806 USDT              |
| Total profit %              | 5.36%                     |
```
### Relevant code exceptions or logs

title: Sell doesn't happen (futures on Okex, dry run)

labels.name: Non-spot
labels.description: Non-spot (margin, leverage, futures) related issues and Pull requests

body: ## Describe your environment * Operating system: Ubuntu 18.04 * Python Version: 3.10.4 (`python -V`) * CCXT version: 1.92.48 (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`) * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2022.8.dev (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker) Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out. ## Describe the problem: Sell order doesn't happen, despite having no issue in logs. title: "No such file or directory" after a hyperopt run doesn't show the results
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 20.04
  * freqtrade 2022.7
  * ccxt==1.91.29
  * Python 3.10.5

## Describe the problem:

I run this command:
> time docker-compose run --rm freqtrade hyperopt --hyperopt-loss CalmarHyperOptLoss -j -1 -e 500  --strategy MyStrat --spaces buy stoploss roi trailing --timerange 20210807-20220106 -i 4h --timeframe-detail 30m --strategy-path user_data/strategies/production

After finishing the run:
> [Epoch 500 of 500 (100%)] ||| [Time:  1:03:11, Elapsed Time: 1:03:11]

Epochs are saved:
> 2022-08-20 16:42:25,222 - freqtrade.optimize.hyperopt - INFO - 500 epochs saved to '/freqtrade/user_data/hyperopt_results/strategy_MyStrat_2022-08-20_15-37-32.fthypt'.

But I get this error:

  ```
2022-08-20 16:42:25,229 - freqtrade - ERROR - Fatal exception!
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/freqtrade/freqtrade/main.py", line 37, in main
    return_code = args['func'](args)
  File "/freqtrade/freqtrade/commands/optimize_commands.py", line 107, in start_hyperopt
    hyperopt.start()
  File "/freqtrade/freqtrade/optimize/hyperopt.py", line 573, in start
    HyperoptTools.try_export_params(
  File "/freqtrade/freqtrade/optimize/hyperopt_tools.py", line 77, in try_export_params
    fn = HyperoptTools.get_strategy_filename(config, strategy_name)
  File "/freqtrade/freqtrade/optimize/hyperopt_tools.py", line 44, in get_strategy_filename
    strategy_objs = StrategyResolver.search_all_objects(
  File "/freqtrade/freqtrade/resolvers/iresolver.py", line 197, in search_all_objects
    for entry in directory.iterdir():
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/pathlib.py", line 1017, in iterdir
    for name in self._accessor.listdir(self):
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'user_data/strategies/production'                                                                                                   
 ```
And hyperopt exits with ERROR: 1.

Correct behavior would have been to give a warning (since the fact that the directory doesn't exist didn't affect the run) and show the results.

Note that the /production directory doesn't contain the strategy, the strategy was in user_data/strategies, that's why the hyperopt command worked.

title: backtesting throws error: KeyError: 'API3/USDT'
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 20.04
  * freqtrade 2022.7
  * ccxt==1.91.29
  * Python 3.10.5

## Describe the problem:

Trying to backtest a strategy with the futures pairs downloaded from https://www.sandwich.finance/ (correct timeframe, all data in the timerange downloaded). Note that some pairs might not have all the data in that timerange or might not be listed during that time. Still, that shouldn't produce a KeyError and FTT is quite old.

Command:
docker-compose run --rm freqtrade backtesting --strategy mystrat  --timerange 20210807-20220106 --timeframe 5m 

I run the strategy on the downloaded timeframe, 5 minutes timeframe and I get multiple KeyErrors: APE, API3, BNX, DAR, DUSK, FLOW, FTT, GAL, GMT, IMX, JASMY, OP, WOO /USDT. I comment them from the backtesting config files and the backtesting works.
  
### Relevant code exceptions or logs

title: Database locking error when trades happen in rapid succession
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Linux (Debian 11.4)
  * Python Version: 3.9.2
  * CCXT version: 1.91.29 (inside the venv)
  * Freqtrade Version: `develop` branch, commit `a4bada3e`
  * Exchange: Kraken

## Describe the problem:

If I place a few forcebuys one after another, a few seconds apart (as I often do when buying some tokens that tend to move together), sometimes one of those buys will be lost from freqtrade's view.  What I mean is, the bot will successfully place the order on the exchange, the buy will execute and fill normally, but then freqtrade will throw the error below and then fail to add the new trade to its database.

As far as I can tell, the trade is completely lost to freqtrade at that point -- it doesn't seem to retry the failed database insert (or perhaps it does after a lengthy delay?).  I have to go to the exchange, sell the token there, then do the buy again.  This second try usually works.

That's easy enough to catch when doing forcebuys, but occasionally the strategy will see fit to buy a number of pairs all at once, and if that should happen while the user is away, money could be lost.

I thought maybe it was a corrupt or broken trades database, so I tried closing all open trades, shutting down the bot, and deleting the database and the two ancillary files that go with it, then letting the bot recreate what it needs as it starts up, but that didn't help.

This didn't start until after I updated freqtrade on July 31, which put the code at commit `a4bada3e`, as noted above.  I use `setup.sh -u` to do that, so I can at least be sure that all dependencies/libraries are up-to-date also.

`git log -g` shows that freqtrade was at commit `0669d93f` before I updated.  I don't think these errors were happening at that point, but I could be wrong.  Prior to that, freqtrade was at commit `e52f82b5`, and I am 100% certain there were no problems then.

Those two previous updates were pulled on July 11 and July 8, respectively, if I read the log right.  I've been on the `develop` branch the whole time.

I only have one instance of freqtrade running.

title: ftx: Freqtrade is trying to close non existing trades
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: ___Docker_
  * Python Version: __3___ (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: _____ (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: _latest develop___ (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
### Observed Results:

All trades have been closed on the exchange however the logs are populated with the below info for multiple pairs. Exchange is FTX.

```
 Marking Trade(id=2, pair=SOL/USDT, amount=38.94000000, is_short=False, leverage=1.0, open_rate=40.71750000, open_since=closed) as closed as the trade is fulfilled and found no open orders for it

 Marking Trade(id=1, pair=ETH/USDT, amount=0.77500000, is_short=False, leverage=1.0, open_rate=1636.29961290, open_since=closed) as closed as the trade is fulfilled and found no open orders for it.
```
I've deleted the previous orders from the dbtabase to fix this kind of log message, however, there are many trades that just keep on popping up in the logs, and not sure what is causing it. Technically not causing issues with further executions as far as I see but the log looks concerning.

title: "Could not set leverage due to AuthenticationError." when open trade on Gateio (futures leverage) after last dev update

labels.name: CCXT
labels.description: Issues related to communication with ccxt (may or may not be caused by upstream issues)

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Docker
  * Freqtrade Version: docker-0806f253
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

Freqtrade gives an error when opening a new futures leveraged trade on Gate.io in live mode after last develop update (I use a develop_plot branch). 
This error is missing on previous docker-78f77f6d build.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Run Freqtrade in live, futures mode on the gate.io
  2. Wait for try to open new trade
  3. Look log
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
  "Could not set leverage due to AuthenticationError."

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

  ```

title: gateio: Telegram /status USDT 'Entry Amount' not always correct

labels.name: Non-spot
labels.description: Non-spot (margin, leverage, futures) related issues and Pull requests

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Fedora 34 with docker
  * Python Version: 3.10
  * CCXT version: 1.90.40
  * Freqtrade Version: docker-494e0529

## Describe the problem:

Telegram /status Entry Amount not always correct. 

### Steps to reproduce:

Not sure.. can't find a common factor. Happens with longs and shorts, with prices above and below 1. I'm using leverage 1. 

Config snippet:
```
  "bot_name": "freqtrade",
    "initial_state": "running",
    "force_entry_enable": false,
    "internals": {
        "process_throttle_secs": 5
    },
    "max_open_trades": 5,
    "stake_currency": "USDT",
    "stake_amount": "unlimited",
    "tradable_balance_ratio": 0.99,
    "fiat_display_currency": "USD",
    "dry_run": false,
    "cancel_open_orders_on_exit": false,
    "trading_mode": "futures",
    "margin_mode": "isolated",
    "unfilledtimeout": {
        "entry": 10,
        "exit": 30,
        "exit_timeout_count": 0,
        "unit": "minutes"
    },
    "entry_pricing": {
        "price_side": "other",
        "use_order_book": true,
        "order_book_top": 1,
        "price_last_balance": 0.0,
        "check_depth_of_market": {
            "enabled": false,
            "bids_to_ask_delta": 1
        }
    },
    "exit_pricing":{
        "price_side": "other",
        "use_order_book": true,
        "order_book_top": 1
    },
```

Relevant strategy config:
```
class Strat(IStrategy):
    INTERFACE_VERSION = 3
    timeframe = '5m'
    can_short: bool = True
    minimal_roi = {"0": 1}
    stoploss = -0.05
    trailing_stop = True
    trailing_only_offset_is_reached = True
    trailing_stop_positive = 0.04
    trailing_stop_positive_offset = 0.12
    process_only_new_candles = False
    use_exit_signal = True
    exit_profit_only = False
    ignore_roi_if_entry_signal = True
    startup_candle_count: int = 360
    order_types = {
        "entry": "limit",
        "exit": "limit",
        "emergency_exit": "market",
        "stoploss": "limit",
        "stoploss_on_exchange": True,
        "stoploss_on_exchange_interval": 60,
        "stoploss_on_exchange_limit_ratio": 0.99
    }

    order_time_in_force = {
        'entry': 'gtc',
        'exit': 'gtc'
    }
```

### Observed Results:

  * What happened?

For example, this one is correct:

```
Trade ID: 11 (since 6 hours ago)
Current Pair: LINK/USDT:USDT
Direction: Short
Leverage: 1.0
Amount: 3.0 (18.4071 USDT)
Enter Tag: <snip>
Open Rate: 6.13570000
Open Date: 2022-07-13 09:16:25
Current Rate: 5.94310000
Current Profit: 3.06%
Stoploss: 6.44248500 (-5.00%)
Stoploss distance: 0.49938500 (8.40%)
  
Entry #1:
Entry Amount: 3.0 (18.40710000 USDT)
Average Entry Price: 6.1357
```
Here, the USDT Entry amount is `Entry Amount` * `Average Entry Price`: 3.0 * 6.1357 = 18.4071 USDT.  

This one is wrong:
```
Trade ID: 10 (since 11 hours ago)
Current Pair: ALGO/USDT:USDT
Direction: Short
Leverage: 1.0
Amount: 60.0 (17.988 USDT)
Enter Tag: <snip>
Open Rate: 0.29980000
Open Date: 2022-07-13 04:30:09
Current Rate: 0.29960000
Current Profit: -0.01%
Stoploss: 0.31479000 (-5.00%)
Stoploss distance: 0.01519000 (5.07%)
  
Entry #1:
Entry Amount: 60.0 (179.88000000 USDT)
Average Entry Price: 0.2998
```
Entry amount should be `Entry Amount` * `Average Entry Price`: 60.0 * 0.2998 = 17.988 USDT. But it's listed as 179.88 , factor 10 higher.

  * What did you expect to happen?

Correct calculations :)

### Relevant code exceptions or logs
Logs:
