title: Closed position by stoploss_on_exchange on gate.io not detected until restart

labels.name: CCXT
labels.description: Issues related to communication with ccxt (may or may not be caused by upstream issues)

labels.name: Non-spot
labels.description: Non-spot (margin, leverage, futures) related issues and Pull requests

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Fedora 34 with docker
  * Python Version: 3.10
  * CCXT version: 1.90.40
  * Freqtrade Version: docker-494e0529 (not running stable because of #7043 )
  
## Describe the problem:

I'm running a bot on gate.io futures. I'm using stoploss_on_exchange. When the exchange closes the position because of the stop order, freqtrade does not detect this until it's restarted. 

### Steps to reproduce:

Config snippet:

```
  "bot_name": "freqtrade",
    "initial_state": "running",
    "force_entry_enable": false,
    "internals": {
        "process_throttle_secs": 5
    },
    "max_open_trades": 5,
    "stake_currency": "USDT",
    "stake_amount": "unlimited",
    "tradable_balance_ratio": 0.99,
    "fiat_display_currency": "USD",
    "dry_run": false,
    "cancel_open_orders_on_exit": false,
    "trading_mode": "futures",
    "margin_mode": "isolated",
    "unfilledtimeout": {
        "entry": 10,
        "exit": 30,
        "exit_timeout_count": 0,
        "unit": "minutes"
    },
    "entry_pricing": {
        "price_side": "other",
        "use_order_book": true,
        "order_book_top": 1,
        "price_last_balance": 0.0,
        "check_depth_of_market": {
            "enabled": false,
            "bids_to_ask_delta": 1
        }
    },
    "exit_pricing":{
        "price_side": "other",
        "use_order_book": true,
        "order_book_top": 1
    },
```

Relevant strategy config:

```
class Strat(IStrategy):
    INTERFACE_VERSION = 3
    timeframe = '5m'
    can_short: bool = True
    minimal_roi = {"0": 1}
    stoploss = -0.05
    trailing_stop = True
    trailing_only_offset_is_reached = True
    trailing_stop_positive = 0.04
    trailing_stop_positive_offset = 0.12
    process_only_new_candles = False
    use_exit_signal = True
    exit_profit_only = False
    ignore_roi_if_entry_signal = True
    startup_candle_count: int = 360
    order_types = {
        "entry": "limit",
        "exit": "limit",
        "emergency_exit": "market",
        "stoploss": "limit",
        "stoploss_on_exchange": True,
        "stoploss_on_exchange_interval": 60,
        "stoploss_on_exchange_limit_ratio": 0.99
    }

    order_time_in_force = {
        'entry': 'gtc',
        'exit': 'gtc'
    }
```  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
I have `max_open_trades` set to 5. When gate.io closes the position because of stoploss, freqtrade doesn't detect this, there is no mention of it in the log, and doesn't open a new position (which it should according to my strategy). 

The position was closed on 2022-07-11 06:52 UTC. Logs around that time:

```
2022-07-11 06:44:45,255 - freqtrade.worker - INFO - Bot heartbeat. PID=1, version='docker-494e0529', state='RUNNING'

Note the warning, it's the only ExchangeNotAvailable I've had since I started 9 days ago. Not exactly at 06:52, and even if it was, I think freqtrade should still be able to detect the closed position. But.. perhaps still relevant.

title: Gateio fee fix
body:
## Summary
Gateio Fees do not use contract size. 
The logic in ccxt for this changed recently, which caused an endless loop of "could not find fees".
This PR aims to fix that.

Closes #7043
closes #7042

title: Weird looping behaviour on gateio
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Docker
  * Python Version: 3.10
  * CCXT version: 1.89.14
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.6
  
## Describe the problem:
So, I've just started with freqtrade. Maybe I did something wrong. Got a little feedback on discord though, which didn't immediately point to something obvious. 

I have created a configuration and a strategy to run on gateio futures. It works fine in dry-run. However, when I set dry-run to false, whenever the strategy enters a trade, that trade triggers an unexpected loop.

### Steps to reproduce:

config snippet:
```
    "bot_name": "freqtrade",
    "initial_state": "running",
    "force_entry_enable": false,
    "internals": {
        "process_throttle_secs": 5
    },
    "max_open_trades": 5,
    "stake_currency": "USDT",
    "stake_amount": "unlimited",
    "tradable_balance_ratio": 0.99,
    "fiat_display_currency": "USD",
    "dry_run": false,
    "cancel_open_orders_on_exit": false,
    "trading_mode": "futures",
    "margin_mode": "isolated",
    "unfilledtimeout": {
        "entry": 10,
        "exit": 30,
        "exit_timeout_count": 0,
        "unit": "minutes"
    },
    "entry_pricing": {
        "price_side": "other",
        "use_order_book": true,
        "order_book_top": 1,
        "price_last_balance": 0.0,
        "check_depth_of_market": {
            "enabled": false,
            "bids_to_ask_delta": 1
        }
    },
    "exit_pricing":{
        "price_side": "other",
        "use_order_book": true,
        "order_book_top": 1
    },
```

Relevant strategy config:
```
class Strat(IStrategy):
    INTERFACE_VERSION = 3
    timeframe = '5m'
    can_short: bool = True
    minimal_roi = {"0": 1}
    stoploss = -0.05

        "entry": "limit",
        "exit": "limit",
        "emergency_exit": "market",
        "stoploss": "limit",
        "stoploss_on_exchange": True,
        "stoploss_on_exchange_interval": 60,
        "stoploss_on_exchange_limit_ratio": 0.99
    }

    order_time_in_force = {
        'entry': 'gtc',
        'exit': 'gtc'
    }
```
  
### Observed Results:

* What happened?

When setting stoploss_on_exchange to True, here is the log output snippet that displays the loop (continues indefinately):

title: Closed Futures Trades displayed as Open trades
body:

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Docker
  * Python Version: Docker (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: Docker (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.6 (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

*Explain the problem you have encountered*
I found this glitch in futures live trade mode on gate.io.
After close the Trade and send 'EXITED' message to Telegram, Freqtrade continue display this trade in 'Open orders' table.
I checked it on the exchange (gateio) - the trade is indeed closed and missing.
After delete it by hand (via FreqUI interface), the trade is removed from 'open trades' table, but Fretrade still continue post messages to log about this trade. This behavior is observed with most but not all closed orders.
I only found this bug in version 2022.6

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Run Freqtrade in Live Futures mode on gate.io
  2. Wait when any order closed
  3. See result
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
  Really Closed order in Open orders table
  * What did you expect to happen?
  Hmm.. :)

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Mac OS
  * Python Version:  3.10.4 (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: 1.89.96(`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: develop (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
## Describe the problem:

Upgrading to the latest version gives this error on PG

```
sqlalchemy.exc.ProgrammingError: (psycopg2.errors.UndefinedFunction) operator does not exist: boolean = integer
LINE 4:                 where ft_is_open = 1 and (ft_trade_id, order...
                                         ^
HINT:  No operator matches the given name and argument types. You might need to add explicit type casts.
```
I guess is related to #6794.

Maybe there is a way to set up a CI for PG and make sure it works there as well.

title: Wrong exit_reason in futures long+short trade mode
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Docker
  * Python Version: Docker (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: Docker (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.5.1 (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

When closing positin in futures (long+short) mode by stop_loss or trailing_stop_loss or roi trigger, and at the same time there is an exit signal in the opposite direction, then close reason indicates as exit_signal.
For example, if Freqtrade opens 'long' position then reached the configured 'roi' value and at the moment of exit there is an 'exit_short' signal, then Freqtrade write down 'exit_short' instead of 'roi' as exit reason.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Run freqtrade in futures long+short mode
  2. Wait a situation when 'roi' or 'stop_loss' or 'trailing_stop_loss' triggered and exit signal in the opposite direction active in same time
  3. See Close Reason
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
  Freqtrade write 'exit_tag' of opposite exit signal as Close Reason
  * What did you expect to happen?
  Write true Close Reason

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

Note: Please copy/paste text of the messages, no screenshots of logs please.

  ```
  // paste your log here
  ```

title: scripts/rest_client.py forceenter... doesn't work
body:
* Operating system: CentOS Linux release 7.9.2009 (Core)
  * Python Version: 3.8.5
  * CCXT version: 1.84.39
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.5.1
  
I'm running a command with linux terminal to **force entry a trade**, live trading mode, futures trading on OKX. I've tried two different commands.

1. `docker-compose exec freqtrade python3 scripts/rest_client.py force_enter SOL/USDT:USDT short -c user_data/config.json`

it returns `{"detail": "Method Not Allowed"}`

2. `docker-compose exec freqtrade python3 scripts/rest_client.py force_enter {"pair": "SOL/USDT:USDT", "side": "short"} -c user_data/config.json `

it returns 
```bash
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/freqtrade/scripts/rest_client.py", line 440, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "/freqtrade/scripts/rest_client.py", line 435, in main
    print(json.dumps(getattr(client, command)(*args["command_arguments"])))
TypeError: FtRestClient.force_enter() takes from 3 to 4 positional arguments but 5 were given
```

title: backtest issue with timeframe-detail and custom_entry_price

labels.name: Backtest
labels.description: Issues related backtesting.

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 22.04
  * Python Version: 3.9.13
  * CCXT version: 1.82.61
  * Freqtrade Version: develop-3e7bf6a9e
  
## Describe the problem:
Running a backtest with `--timeframe-detail 1m` results are weird since stoploss in strategy is not respected and few open trades also stay open forever. Stoploss in strategy set with `stoploss = -0.06` in backtest summary metrics I get `Worst trade -79.72%`. Running the backtest for the same strategy without `--timeframe-detail 1m` works correctly.

sample trade ignoring stoploss:
```
                {
                    "pair": "SECO/USD",
                    "stake_amount": 1851.87234599,
                    "amount": 79.29131058,
                    "open_date": "2021-09-06 23:35:00+00:00",
                    "close_date": "2021-12-31 23:55:00+00:00",
                    "open_rate": 23.3553,
                    "close_rate": 17.6868,
                    "fee_open": 0.0007,
                    "fee_close": 0.0007,
                    "trade_duration": 167060,
                    "profit_ratio": -0.24376669,
                    "profit_abs": -451.74079135,
                    "exit_reason": "force_exit",
                    "initial_stop_loss_abs": 21.953982,
                    "initial_stop_loss_ratio": -0.06,
                    "stop_loss_abs": 22.686379751859025,
                    "stop_loss_ratio": -0.025917571839457865,
                    "min_rate": 23.0789,
                    "max_rate": 24.495,
                    "is_open": true,
                    "enter_tag": "generic_ema9_cross_sma20 1_star",
                    "is_short": false,
                    "open_timestamp": 1630971300000.0,
                    "close_timestamp": 1640994900000.0
                }
```

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. `freqtrade backtesting --max-open-trades 3 --strategy-list zond_0_5_3_1 --timerange 20210501-20220101 -c conf_zond_BT.json --fee 0.0007 --timeframe-detail 1m --cache none`
  
### Observed Results:
I noticed this is happening when using in `custom_entry_price` `return current_candle['close'] * 1.003` or `return current_candle['close']` simulating slippage with marketable orders (see lines 1085 and 1090 in /wip/zond_0_5_3_1).
If using for example `return min(current_candle['close'] * 2, proposed_rate)` backtesting with 1m detail, is running correctly.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs
No errors/warnings printed in logs during backtest.

title: Deleting order from database when Position adjust triggered and order timed out
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: WIndows 10 (Freqtrade running in Docker container)
  * Python Version: as in docker container (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: as in docker container (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: 2022.5 (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

When Position adjust triggered and order timed out, then Freqtrade _fully_ remove it from database.
See log with my comments.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Run Freqtrade in LIVE mode with adjust_trade_position() callback and unfilledtimeout.entry configured
  2. Wait while position (1st) order open and fullfilled
  3. Wait while Position adjust (2nd or any next) order open, but not filled and unfilledtimeout.entry triggered
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
 The position will be instantly deleted from the database, disappear from the list and no longer served by Freqtrade.

  * What did you expect to happen?
 Cancel only last adjustment order

title: Webhookexitfill not triggering when SL is on exchange

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Telegram, ReST API, external control, ...

labels.name: Stoploss
labels.description: Related to stoploss

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?
Did you have a VERY good look at the [documentation](https://www.freqtrade.io/en/latest/) and are sure that the question is not explained there

Please do not use the question template to report bugs or to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Windows 10
  * Python Version: _____ Python 3.8
  * CCXT version: _____ ccxt==1.78.23
  * Freqtrade Version: ____freqtrade develop-3359ac6
  
## Your question

I normally use Webhookexitfill to send enter and exit signals into a webserver. Recently I have been trying futures trading, and setting up `stoploss on exchange` option. I see that in the that the trade exits because of a stop loss I never get the exit signal for that trade.
Should I use a different webhook to be able to log that exit? Or is it some way to generate a similar signal when the bot notices that the trade has exited due to reaching an SL?
Thanks

title: setup.sh reference to pre_commit incorrect

labels.name: Install
labels.description: Problems with installation

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Windows 10 with WSL2, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
  * Python Version: 3.8.2
  * Freqtrade Version: develop [0807d31](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/commit/0807d3106fea5c4d4f54050f64b8f808f6d4501c)
  
## Describe the problem:

When installing in a blank Ubuntu 20.04, the `setup.sh -i ` fails with:

```
Installing collected packages: freqtrade
  Running setup.py develop for freqtrade
Successfully installed freqtrade-develop
pip install completed

/home/froggleston/git/freqtrade/.env/bin/python3.8: No module named pre-commit
Failed installing pre-commit
```

On checking the setup.sh, it appears that the reference to pre-commit should be pre_commit:

```
    if [[ $dev =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
        ${PYTHON} -m pre-commit install   <-------------- should be pre_commit
        if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
            echo "Failed installing pre-commit"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
```

title: Emergency sell failed, with previous sell order is partially filled
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search the issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: `Ubuntu 18.04.03`
  * Python Version: `3.8.8` (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: `1.61.92` (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: `2022.1` (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  * Exchange: `kucoin`
  

## Describe the problem:

*Explain the problem you have encountered*

I had an emergency sell failure, and it seems like it's because the previous sell order have been only partially executed.
The log reports this line: `WARNING - Unable to emergency sell trade BASIC/USDT: Not enough amount to sell. Trade-amount: 3254.21, Wallet: 2.953e-05` .

Here are the logs showing the steps leading to the error : 

  1. Sell with a limit price: `2022-02-24 20:21:14,075 - freqtrade.rpc.rpc_manager - INFO - Sending rpc message: {'type': sell, 'trade_id': 256, 'exchange': 'Kucoin', 'pair': 'BASIC/USDT', 'gain': 'profit', 'limit': 0.00404, 'order_type': 'limit', 'amount': 3254.21, 'open_rate': 0.003933618028338675, 'close_rate': None, 'current_rate': 0.00404, 'profit_amount': 0.29429362, 'profit_ratio': 0.02294433, 'buy_tag': None, 'sell_reason': 'sell_signal', 'open_date': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 24, 17, 31, 18, 87721), 'close_date': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 24, 19, 21, 14, 75044), 'stake_currency': 'USDT', 'fiat_currency': 'USD'}` 

  2. Watch the sell order been partially filled:`2022-02-24 20:26:19,728 - freqtrade.rpc.rpc_manager - INFO - Sending rpc message: {'type': sell_cancel, 'trade_id': 256, 'exchange': 'Kucoin', 'pair': 'BASIC/USDT', 'gain': 'profit', 'limit': 0.00404, 'order_type': 'limit', 'amount': 3254.21, 'open_rate': 0.003933618028338675, 'current_rate': 0.00404, 'profit_amount': 0.29429362, 'profit_ratio': 0.02294433, 'buy_tag': None, 'sell_reason': 'sell_signal', 'open_date': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 24, 17, 31, 18, 87721), 'close_date': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 24, 19, 26, 19, 728272, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'stake_currency': 'USDT', 'fiat_currency': 'USD', 'reason': 'partially filled - keeping order open'}`

  3. Emergency sell order is triggered: `2022-02-24 20:26:19,850 - freqtrade.freqtradebot - WARNING - Emergencyselling trade Trade(id=256, pair=BASIC/USDT, amount=3254.21000000, open_rate=0.00393362, open_since=2022-02-24 17:31:18), as the sell order timed out 1 times.`

  4. Emergency order fails: `2022-02-24 20:26:20,063 - freqtrade.freqtradebot - WARNING - Unable to emergency sell trade BASIC/USDT: Not enough amount to sell. Trade-amount: 3254.21, Wallet: 2.953e-05`

When this happened, I checked my account on Kucoin and I saw that the limit sell order was still opened for the amount 3254.21 . So I presume that's why the emergency sell failed.  
If I'm right and this is the reason, it means that the `sell_cancel` message failed. Is this possible, or is it because I misconfigured emergency sell mechanism? Here is what I used as conf:

```
"unfilledtimeout": {
        "buy": 60,
        "sell": 5,
        "unit": "minutes",
        "exit_timeout_count": 1
    },
    "order_time_in_force": {
        "buy": "gtc",
        "sell": "gtc"
    }
```

Thanks in advance for your help !

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Enable emergency sell by setting `"exit_timeout_count": 1`  in the conf
  2. Sell with a limit order which will be partially filled
  2. Have the order partially filled
  3. Emergency sell fails
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened? Emergency sell failed.
  * What did you expect to happen? Emergency sell succeed.

title: TypeError: '<' not supported between instances of 'float' and 'NoneType'
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)
  * Python Version: Python 3.9.9
  * CCXT version: ccxt==1.71.73
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2022.1
  * Exchange: FTX


## Describe the problem:

I checked my telegram and found 200+ messages showing `Status: process died` and bot starting messages. I didn't count how many times it was exactly, but I estimate 30 to 40 times based on the message patterns (200/5)
I checked the logs and pasted the latest relevant section below. Log shows many repeats of the TypeError and the bot restarting.
Bot appears to be running again with no more repeats of TypeError.

title: Stoploss on exchange correctly executed but not cleared in Freqtrade

labels.name: Stoploss
labels.description: Related to stoploss

body:
## Describe your environment * Operating system: Ubuntu 20.04 * Python Version: 3.8.10 * CCXT version: 1.71.73 * Freqtrade Version: develop-06387478b ## Describe the problem: If bot is configured to use market stoploss on exchange (FTX), the stop market order get correctly executed on exchange but Freqtrade still have the trade open not being able to sell it. *Explain the problem you have encountered* Running a live bot on FTX exchange, configured with market stoploss. When the trade was opened, the stoploss market order has been correctly set on exchange. When the trade got stopped, the order on exchange has been correctly and safely executed but Freqtrade still had the trade open and the slot busy with it. ### Steps to reproduce: Strategy is not using `custom_stoploss` nor `confirm_trade_exit` ``` stoploss = -0.03 ``` Configuration used: ``` "order_types": { "buy": "limit", "sell": "market", "emergencysell": "market", "forcesell": "market", "stoploss": "market", "stoploss_on_exchange": true, "stoploss_on_exchange_interval": 60 }, ``` ### Observed Results: * What happened? Trade correctly closed in stoploss at the exchange * What did you expect to happen? Freqtrade selling the trade on database and clearing the slot ### Relevant code exceptions or logs ``` 2022-02-11 09:18:00,325 - freqtrade.exchange.ftx - INFO - stoploss order added for SOL/USD. stop price: 102.8325. ``` ``` 2022-02-11 19:28:43,057 - freqtrade.worker - INFO - Bot heartbeat. PID=28934, version='develop-06387478b, strategy_version: 0.3.6', state='RUNNING' 2022-02-11 19:29:43,094 - freqtrade.worker - INFO - Bot heartbeat. title: Unlimited stake produces different profit results if run with the same strategy via `--strategy-list`

labels.name: Backtest
labels.description: Issues related backtesting.

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Linux
  * Python Version: 3.10
  * CCXT version: unrelated
  * Freqtrade Version: develop
  

## Describe the problem:

Running the exact same strategy produces different results for total profit USD.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8218910/153464237-7ef8af5d-f40f-4922-ae4c-59d04d9aff80.png)


### Steps to reproduce:

  1. clone example `Strategy001` and name it `Strategy001_clone`
  3. create config using `"stake_amount": "unlimited", `
  3. run backtest with `--strategy-list Strategy001_clone Strategy001 --cache none`
  4. compare Total Profit USD columns
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?: Profits are not the same
  * What did you expect to happen? Profits being the same

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

I boiled it down to using different stake_amounts for each run.

This is the offending line, returning different values for `max_stake_amount`:
https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/af984bdc0d1c2dee3e88b7d3ea28bdb1a2a65b56/freqtrade/optimize/backtesting.py#L526-L527

Note: Please copy/paste text of the messages, no screenshots of logs please.

  ```python

# optimize/backtesting/_enter_trade()
        min_stake_amount = self.exchange.get_min_pair_stake_amount(pair, propose_rate, -0.05) or 0
        max_stake_amount = self.wallets.get_available_stake_amount()

        pos_adjust = trade is not None
  ```

title: Problems with first order after enabling DCA
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: ____ Mac
  * Freqtrade Version: ____ docker-730d2e35
  
## Describe the problem:

After setting up a Freqtrade instance in dry mode, with a copy of a live db, and enabling DCA i get:

* Wrong order management
* Wrong average cost calculation
* Wrong profit


### Steps to reproduce:

1. make a copy of a live db, FT stable version, with some open trades
2. setup a dry develop image of FT with the live db copy
3. enable DCA
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
 
1. FT (the strategy) rebuys a coin
2. FT (the strategy) sells the coin (only the amount from last buy) at some price that is not even near the average and declares some incorrect profit (taking in consideration the total amount for the coin)
3. FT closes the whole trade from db (note the amount sold was only the amount from last buy ) 
  

* What did you expect to happen?

2. FT (the strategy) sells the coin (total amount) at some price higher than the average cost and declares the real profit
3. FT closes the whole trade from db only if it completely sells the coin


### Relevant code exceptions or logs

Note: Please copy/paste text of the messages, no screenshots of logs please.

  ```

title: Webserver, Informative Decorator breaks "Visualize Results" Chart Display
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Windows WSL(Debian) Docker
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade docker-bb1d8fb5 (develop)
  
## Describe the problem:

Once the informative decorator is used within a strategy, you can not visualize results anymore in the Webserver, a exception is thrown.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Define a Informative Pair inside the Strategy with the Decorator (you dont have to actively use it)
  
```
    @informative('1h')
    def populate_indicators_1h(self, dataframe: DataFrame, metadata: dict) -> DataFrame:
        dataframe['rsi'] = ta.RSI(dataframe, timeperiod=14)

        return dataframe
```

  2. Start the Webserver
  3. Start the Backtest
  4. Click on Visualize Results
  5. Click on one of the Pairs were a Trade happened
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?

Upon clicking on "Visualize Results" and after that on a pair where a trade happened, a exception is thrown, and the chart is not displayed.

title: Crypto.com crash on market buy

labels.description: Issues concerning exchanges that are currently unsupported

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: ubuntu
  * Python Version: 3.9
  * CCXT version: 1.65.78
  * Freqtrade Version: 2021.12

## Describe the problem:

Hello, I recently wanted to test the creation of a bot with the new exchange supported by ccxt since version 1.65.78 which is crypto.com. Unfortunately, everything worked fine until the bot placed a market buy order.

### Steps to reproduce:

title: PerformanceFilter 'min_profit' example value in the docs should be a percentage not a ratio

labels.name: Pairlist
labels.description: Issues / PR's related to Pairlists / pairlist handling

body: The docs show "min_profit": 0.01 for PerformanceFilter as an example, but it should actually be a percentage not a ratio. The Trade.get_overall_performance() method that this filter uses returns a percentage not a ratio. I think some explanation should be there as I think most people would assume 0.01 is a ratio as 0.01% is tiny.

title: Freqtrade closes trade below candlestick low price
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search our issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 16.04
  * Python Version: 3.7.5
  * CCXT version: 1.57.3
  * Freqtrade Version: 2021.9
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

*Explain the problem you have encountered*

I created a simple strategy that works on the 5 min timeframe. With this strategy the bot buys when the RSI <= 25 and sells when the price closes at least 2% below the trailing stoploss. 

When I backtest the strategy I notice that the bot closes most of the trades after 0 minutes at a price that is below the candlestick low. Plotting the dataframe helped to visualize the issue. 

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Run the backtest using Binance historical data: freqtrade backtesting --strategy RsiTestStrategy --timerange=20210121-20210122 -p CTK/USDT -c config_backtrader.json
  2. Check the first trade in the backtest log
  3. Plotting helps to visualize the issue: freqtrade plot-dataframe --strategy RsiTestStrategy -p CTK/USDT --timerange=20210121-20210122 --indicators2 rsi  --config config_backtrader.json
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
       The bot opens a trade on the CTK/USDT pair the 21/Jan/2021 at 14:10 purchasing CTK at the price of 1.1754 USDT, setting a training stoploss at 1.151892. 

       Candle details:
        Open: 1.1754
        Close: 1.1586
        High: 1.2049
        Low: 1.1586

       After 0 minutes the bot triggers the stoploss and closes the position selling the trade at 1.151892 (Value below the candlestick low).   
 
       The same problem repeats for most of the trades 

  * What did you expect to happen?
     The bot shouldn't have closed the trade yet
      I'm not sure this is a bug, I probably messed up with the configuration. 
      
       Thanks for your help.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

Note: Please copy/paste text of the messages, no screenshots of logs please.

  ```
  **The trade log:** 
{"pair":"CTK/USDT","stake_amount":    100.0,"amount":85.07742045,"open_date":"2021-01-21 14:10:00+00:00",
"close_date":"2021-01-21 14:10:00+00:00","open_rate":1.1754,"close_rate":1.151892,"fee_open":0.001,
"fee_close":0.001,"trade_duration":0,"profit_ratio":-0.02195804,"profit_abs":-2.198,
"sell_reason":"trailing_stop_loss","initial_stop_loss_abs":1.151892,"initial_stop_loss_ratio":-0.02,
"stop_loss_abs":1.1808020000000001,"stop_loss_ratio":-0.02,"min_rate":1.1586,"max_rate":1.2049,
"is_open":false,"buy_tag":null,"open_timestamp":1611238200000.0,"close_timestamp":1611238200000.0}
```

``` python
class RsiTestStrategy(IStrategy):
   
    INTERFACE_VERSION = 2

    minimal_roi = {
        "0": 100
    }

    stoploss = -0.02

    trailing_stop = True

    }

        },
        'subplots': {

            # },
            "RSI": {
                'rsi': {'color': 'red'},
            }
        }
    }
    def informative_pairs(self):
        return []

    def populate_indicators(self, dataframe: DataFrame, metadata: dict) -> DataFrame:
        # RSI
        dataframe['rsi'] = ta.RSI(dataframe)

        return dataframe

    def populate_buy_trend(self, dataframe: DataFrame, metadata: dict) -> DataFrame:
       
        dataframe.loc[
            (
                (dataframe['rsi'] <= 25) &  # Guard: tema below BB middle
                (dataframe['volume'] > 0)  # Make sure Volume is not 0
            ),
            'buy'] = 1

        return dataframe

    def populate_sell_trend(self, dataframe: DataFrame, metadata: dict) -> DataFrame:
       
        return dataframe

title: PR #5580 changed random hyperopt iterations to 5
body: Just an oddity I noticed: Pull Request #5580 added support for custom Hyperopt estimators. In the first [commit ](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/pull/5580/commits/994c3c3a4c5f36c02d249f4c13466b284c4991af) it also changed the number of random iterations from 30 to 5 though, and there is no explanation given as to why. The documentation also still mention 30 iterations being the default. Was this intended?

title: Bot thinks order is fulfilled while actually it is completely expired on exchange
body:
I have a live setup with Docker & Freqtrade 2021.7.

Quite frequently I see some sell orders by the bot, however the bot wrongly marks the sell as fulfilled, although in Binance exchange the sell order is expired (not even a partial fill, fully expired).

See an example log sequence of such a buy and then sell order below. The position is then marked as Closed on Freq UI, however on Binance the order is fully expired.

Is this a bug and is there a solution for this other than trying to manually fix the Sqlite database?

title: Fix no-event-loop available
body:
## Summary
Fix no-event-loop available

closes #5433

title: Running asyncio.get_event_loop() in some thread other than the main thread – however, asyncio only generates an event loop for the main thread.
body:
OS: Ubuntu 21.04
Branch: develop
Command: freqtrade trade --config config.json --strategy SampleStrategy
....
Error Message: 
Exception in thread Thread-1:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/threading.py", line 954, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/threading.py", line 892, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/fredtrade/develop/freqtrade/freqtrade/rpc/api_server/uvicorn_threaded.py", line 36, in run
    loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/asyncio/events.py", line 642, in get_event_loop
    raise RuntimeError('There is no current event loop in thread %r.'
RuntimeError: There is no current event loop in thread 'Thread-1'.

Solution: 
File - ./freqtrade/rpc/api_server/uvicorn_threaded.py
Line - 36

Change:
```
        loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
```
To:
```
        try:
            loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
        except RuntimeError as ex:
            if "There is no current event loop in thread" in str(ex):
                asyncio.set_event_loop(asyncio.new_event_loop())
                loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()                
```

title: Generic Web Server Directory Traversal Vulnerability

labels.name: freqUI
labels.description: issues related to frequi

body: THREAT: Using directory traversal techniques, a malicious user can access known files outside of the Web root. This is made possible through the use of "../", "..", "\../", ".../", or "..../", etc., sequences in an HTTP request. By exploiting this vulnerability, malicious users can retrieve any file on the filesystem, including system files. For example, FreqUI is vulnerable to GET ///etc/passwd HTTP/1.0

title: ERROR - Fatal exception - on sell timeout
body:

title: Fix recently introduced lookahead bias in backtesting
body:
## Summary
Fix recently introduced lookahead bias in backtesting
Introduced in  b1cbc75e93740e3f62ec5ed6c1a5b0e2d0c4ff80 by caching the dataframe after trimming and removal of the first candle.

closes #5388 

## Quick changelog

- Fix bug
- Improve test to be more precise for this specific case.

title: Analyzed dataframe returns future row in backtesting.
Nonetype error after hyperopting
exchange.validate_required_startup_candles only executes if startup_candle_count is defined in config.json?
body:
Is this expected behavior? If I define startup_candle_count inside a strategy file, everything works fine, but if I define it in config.json, a message saying 

`This strategy requires 2400 candles to start. Binance only provides 1000 for 1h. `

Use case:
I have the data downloaded and want to use only 1h candles in the strategy, so I set startup_candle_count in the strategy to 2400. Everything works.
I want to do the same but in config.json, because I want one config file per strategy, so I define startup_candle_count:2400 and I get the mentioned message and an exception.

I commented this code for now to get everything working:
Line 152 exchange.py
```
            # self.validate_required_startup_candles(config.get('startup_candle_count', 0),
            #                                        config.get('timeframe', ''))
``` 
even though Binance might provide 1000 candles only, why not include downloaded data (assuming this is an actual problem in live/dry run), or **was the design in these situations to just download and use 1d candles?**

title: Bot crashing after few hours of running (FTX)
body:
Hi Matthias,
I've started the bot live (dry run false), but it works just for a few hours and then it crashes (like 10/15h). Stoploss works smoothly. Don't know about sell orders yet because I had none. Fortunately stoploss orders remain on the exchange (FTX) after the crash, so risk is limited to that even if the bot crashes.

This happens just if dry run = false. In dry run = true everything works.

body:

-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu18.04
  * Python Version: Python 3.9.4
  * CCXT version: 1.48.76
  * Freqtrade Version: 2021.4
  
## Describe the problem:

Exchange: binance

When excuted the https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/9465fd390a36f3e1425e717506c3aed9f4302221/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py#L520
if the market price buy order or limit price buy order be filled immediately.The order status is closed, so it enters https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/9465fd390a36f3e1425e717506c3aed9f4302221/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py#L619 , Since the `is_open` of the new trade class is `None`.So it will enter the sell_fill logic https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/9465fd390a36f3e1425e717506c3aed9f4302221/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py#L1378
This will cause the protection to be executed and the sell_fill notification to be sent

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. dry_run
  2. order_types.buy = market
  3. strategy use always buy
  
### Observed Results:

  * buy action trigger the sell's `protections`
  * buy_fill notify becomes sell_fill notify
  * The buy_filled notice arrives before the buy notice and the trade id is None(It doesn't matter,just by the way)

title: Incorrect/superfluous `cancelled due to timeout`
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search our issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Mac
  * Python Version: 3.9 (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: 1.41.70 (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version:  develop-4cb67f14 (`freqtrade -V` or `docker-compose run --rm freqtrade -V` for Freqtrade running in docker)
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

This is an problem I observed in the Telegram messages and it occurs in production (not dry-run).


### Steps to reproduce:

Since it's only reproducible in production, I can't describe the steps here (that will be hard and also dangerous).
But I will describe what the bot did and how I observed the issue.

Assume their's only one tradable pair XXX: 
  1. Bot opens buy order and the order is filled
  2. Bot opens cell order and the order cannot be filled in time; bot times out and cancelled the sell order 
  3. Bot re-opens another sell order after a while, the sell order is again cannot be filled immediately. 
  4. Command `\status` in Telegram. 

### Observed Results:

Telegram RPC comes back with:
```
Trade ID: _ (since 9 hours ago)
Current Pair: XXX
Amount:  10 (... USD)
Open Rate: ...
Current Rate: ...
Current Profit: ...%
Stoploss: ... (-...%)
Stoploss distance: ... (-..%)
Open Order: (limit sell rem=10) - cancelled due to timeout
```

Notice the _cancelled due to timeout_ message at the very end.
The new sell order is not cancelled  at this point, but it is reported as cancelled. 

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

I think the problem is caused by this line https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/develop/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py#L1247.
Notice that `trade.sell_order_status` is only modified here (other than `migrations.py` and `models.py`, which I don't believe are relevant for this issue). 
I think what happened was 
1. `trade.sell_order_status` is changed to "cancelled due to timeout" at this line due to the first cancelled sell order
2. the flag is never reset/cleared when the second sell order comes in

Not a huge problem but would be nice for a fix (to avoid future confusion)

body:

## Describe the problem:
Freqtrade crashes when using FTX.US. Seems like it's related to the stop loss order? OR entering/pulling data from the database?

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Configuring ftx.us as the exchange in the config file (as instructed in [](https://github.com/ccxt/ccxt/issues/7461#issuecomment-673535274)):
  ```
"exchange": {
        "name": "ftx",
        "key": "",
        "secret": "",
        "ccxt_config": {
            "enableRateLimit": true,             
            "hostname": "ftx.us"
        },
        "ccxt_async_config": {
            "enableRateLimit": true,
            "rateLimit": 500
        },
```
  
  2. Running the bot. Seems like it's cancelling the stop-loss order trying to create a new one and then crashes. I think it's related to the database? I saw a lot of these rows when running on dry-run but I though it's only because it is dry run. And it never crashed on dry-run either.:

title: When I manually delete a trade freqtrade often crashes

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Telegram, ReST API, external control, ...

body:
* Operating system: Ubuntu 20.04: 5.4.0-65-generic #73-Ubuntu SMP Mon Jan 18 17:25:17 UTC 2021 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64
  * Python Version: Python 3.8.5
  * CCXT version: 1.39.79
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade 2021.1
  
## Describe the problem:

I have installed freqtrade on Ubuntu, using the git stable release via the setup script.  I run multiple instances of ft using screen.  I am using Binance as my exchange, I have bots running using 3 different Binance accounts, this issue occurs with them all so it does not seem to be account related.

When I delete a trade manually via telgram ft often crashes.  I've only been using ft recently and have observed the issue with freqtrade 2021.1 and freqtrade 2020.12.

### Steps to reproduce:
From the telegram interface delete your desired trade:

  1. /delete 813
  
### Observed Results:
On telegram:

Deleted trade 813. Closed 1 open orders.
Please make sure to take care of this asset on the exchange manually.

Status: process died

I'm finding that when I manually delete a trade via the telegram interface (/delete 813) for example I see the message "process died) and when I check the screen console session I have the following output

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

Note: Please copy/paste text of the messages, no screenshots of logs please.

title: Wrong convertion BTCST/BTC

labels.name: RPC
labels.description: Telegram, ReST API, external control, ...

body:
When calling /balance command in Telegram bot:
BTCST:
 Available:  0.00486000
 Balance:  0.00486000
 Pending:  0.00000000
 Est. BTC:  2.47001423

Seems like wrong formula used: 2.47001423/0.00486 = 508,2333806584
But actual price is 0,0019676 what is 0.00486/2.47001423

title: Fix disappearing pairs pairlist bug
body:
## Summary
Fix pairlistbug where pairlist combinations (StaticPairlist combined with "something") could suffer from "disappearing" pairlists (introduced in #4197), as the pairlist never reset to the original pairlist, so pairs once removed never reappeared.

closes #4277

## Quick changelog

- add test confirming what's happening
- Fix bug (and remove now-obsolete properties)

title: Fix valueerror in case of empty array files
body:
## Summary
Having an empty file or empty array should not crash dataloading with ValueError

## Quick changelog

* Capture error
* add testcase for this

title: Hyperopt crashes when using the protections feature
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search our issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: macOS Cataline 10.15.7
  * Python Version: Python 3.8.5
  * CCXT version:ccxt==1.40.30
  * Freqtrade Version: develop-d289fe44
 

## Describe the problem:
The documentation states that Hyperopt supports the protections feature. However, Hyperopts crash when `--enable-protections` is used.  The Hyperopt itself works fine without enabling the protections.

Unfortunately I haven't been able to check whether it works inside a Docker container.

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create a configuration with protections:
```
      "protections": [
        {
            "method": "StoplossGuard",
            "lookback_period_candles": 24,
            "trade_limit": 8,
            "stop_duration_candles": 12,
            "only_per_pair": false
        },
        {
            "method": "CooldownPeriod",
            "stop_duration_candles": 12
        }      
    ],
```

title: StoplossGuard should include stoploss_on_exchange as well
body:
The document is here: https://www.freqtrade.io/en/latest/configuration/#stoploss-guard

But it should include stoploss_on_exchange as well.

title: Possibly slightly wrong informative pair merging
body:
When merging longer timeframe to a shorter one, the timedelta is added to the date:
https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/f320cb0d7a12e064018967cf049dd6719fff8ddb/freqtrade/strategy/strategy_helper.py#L35

then it merges to the shorter timeframe with these dates..
https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/f320cb0d7a12e064018967cf049dd6719fff8ddb/freqtrade/strategy/strategy_helper.py#L42-L43

So lets say we are merging a `1h` timeframe to a `5m` timeframe and there is a signal `True` at `00:00` on the `1h` timeseries. 
With this merge, the signal will appear in the `5m` timeseries also at `00:00`. However the `00:00` candle for the `5m` timeframe is received at `00:05`, that is five minutes later than the time you actually received the `1h` candle, which should have been received at the candle with date `11:55`. 
So after merging, the values should be shifted backward (`shift(-1)`)..or the merging dates should be reduced by one unit of timedelta of the shorter timeframe..
```python
informative['date_merge'] = informative["date"] + pd.to_timedelta(minutes_inf, 'm') - pd.to_timedelta(minutes, 'm')
```

title: Avoid high fee wrong reports
body:
## Summary
Due to a current bug in ccxt, fees can be misrepresented if a (market / marketable limit) order fills with 2 trades, using 2 different fee currencies to pay for fees.

Freqtrade will therefore assume fees > 2% as eroneous (when comming from orders) and will fall back to the "trade-based" calculation method for fees, which does cover this correctly already.
 

Closes #3922, closes #3984

## Quick changelog

- Fix Bug when fees are overstated by ccxt, causing freqtrade profit calculation to be wrong.
- add test to cover this scenario (ensuring we're not regressing this in the future)

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Windows 10
  * Python Version: 3.8.5
  * CCXT version: 1.36.85
  * Freqtrade Version: 2020.10
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

trades stored as hdf5 look like this when imported:
 ```[1600387752313, nan, 'limit', 'buy', 39.95, 33.61046059, 1342.7379005705002] ```
downloaded trades look like this: 
 ```[1600387752313, None, 'limit', 'buy', 39.95, 33.61046059, 1342.7379005705002] ```
because nan ≠ None, trades_remove_duplicates() will think they are different trades and therefore not remove the duplicate

Balance is not updated after sell on Bittrex live.      Calling  /balance in Telegram shows all ever bought assets (tested for 3 Days) although they where successfully sold.

title: handling of startup period

labels.name: Backtest
labels.description: Issues related backtesting.

body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search our issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: ____
  * Python Version: Python 3.8.0 (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: _____ (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade develop-4c349342
  
Note: All issues other than enhancement requests will be closed without further comment if the above template is deleted or not filled out.

## Describe the problem:

*Explain the problem you have encountered*

### Steps to reproduce:

- exchange:
 binance
- timerange: 
20190301-20190501
- pairlist: 
BTC/USDT,ETH/USDT,XMR/USDT
- startup_period: 
anything >0 like 20
- run a backtest

### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
XMR/USDT is not trimmed
  * What did you expect to happen?
all pairs to get clipped by startup period
### Relevant code exceptions or logs

Startup period is trimmed by reducing the timerange that includes all the pairs by the required length
the the timerange is made of the union, not the intersection, so trimming by date on data where that period is missing won't trim anything.
I just make sure that the length of the df after the trim by timerange is at least short of the `required_startup` 

Rare case: after that adjustment a df can be left empty, so I was removing those because some operations might error out if applied on an empty df.

During optimization, if you are generating indicators within pop buy/sell you have to account for startup yourself. 

To fix for all the cases maybe do not add the required_startup to the timerange trim here:
https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/4c34934258457ffeb53f57c187e4639091c8966b/freqtrade/optimize/backtesting.py#L146

instead exclude the first rows by index right before executing the 
backtest (so within the backtest function), maybe here
https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/4c34934258457ffeb53f57c187e4639091c8966b/freqtrade/optimize/backtesting.py#L314

title: Forcesell should use the available methods for handling a trade correctly
body:
## Summary
Currently, forcesell handles states of cancelled orders seperately, and out of line with regular cancels.
This leads to a disconnect, and to odd behavior if a trade is force/sold while an order is still open.

Closes #3084

## Quick changelog

- Disable double-notification in case of partial buy cancels
- have forcesell call the available methods from freqtrade to cancel orders.

title: Cancelled Order was not cancelled on Exchange
body:
<!-- 
Have you searched for similar issues before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search our issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

Please do not use bug reports to request new features.
-->

## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Raspbian
  * Python Version: Python 3.7.3
  * CCXT version: ccxt==1.32.7
  * Freqtrade Version: freqtrade develop-f3af02c0
  
## Describe the problem:

A trade was created, then timeout was reached and the open buy order closed. However Trade was filled on exchange. The bot then continued to buy a very small amount of this pair and close it. The big buy was not stored in the database so it could not handle it. Telegram bot said "No active trade". This is quite serious as from what I observed the bot was fine with its actions, however there was still an ongoing Trade which it had no idea of and could not close. I just stumbled upon this when looking into Binance and seeing that there are coins the bot bought although it said it did not buy them.

title: Fix edge with removebumps enabled
body:
## Summary
Edge currently fails due to an error in a (uncovered) line when removebumps is enabled.
it seems like this is the first case this option has been used - or other users did not report this problem previously.

closes #3637 
## Quick changelog

- add test covering this scenario (fails without 2nd commit)
- add fix for this case

title: Fix pairfilter crash
body:
## Summary
Pairfilter should not crash if last returns 0.

fixes  #3615

title: Allow 0 fee value by correctly checking for None
body:
## Summary
Fees of 0.0 (or 0) sholuld also be allowed, since some exchanges allow free trades (and it can be useful for testing, eventually).

closes #3594

title: configure fee to 0 using --fee argument take default exchange fees instead of 0
body:
Hi,

During early stage of developing a strategy i put fees to 0 to see winrate when i close the trade after 1 bar, 2 bars, ... .
No matter i 'force' the fees to 0 it seems the fallback to default exchange fees if the value choose is under the exchange fee.

Have a nice day.

title: Possible workaround for market orders not working for exchanges like Upbit?
body:
* Operating system:  Linux
  * Python Version:  3.8.2
  * CCXT version: 1.30.48
  * Freqtrade Version: 2020.6

After setting orders to market orders in the config file, I was getting the fatal exception posted at the bottom of this issue.  Using the fetch_order function from ccxt it was deteremined the "**amount**" shouldn't be "**None**".

After filing an issue with ccxt, a response was posted from Kroitor:

[https://github.com/ccxt/ccxt/issues/7235]

To summarize, Upbit just doesn't output the information needed to allow market orders to work, as is with many other exchanges that use market orders.  It was also suggested that:

> If you can paste a link to your freqtrade issue we could try to address it in collaboration with the authors of freqtrade. In this particular case, I would suggest freqtrade to add the code for the following:
> 
> check if it's a market order
> check if the amount is not defined
> then use the filled value instead

title: Market order on the Bittrex exchange causes freqtrade to close

labels.name: CCXT
labels.description: Issues related to communication with ccxt (may or may not be caused by upstream issues)

body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: ____Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS
  * Python Version: _____ Python 3.6.9
  * CCXT version: _____ccxt==1.30.52
  * Freqtrade Version: ____ freqtrade develop-ff4ff22f

  
## Describe the problem:
Market order on the Bittrex exchange causes freqtrade to close

### Observed Results:

  * What happened?

The buy, sell or stop order, regardless of which one is, closes the freqtrade with the process died message when the market order takes place. The error message also says "ValueError: Unknown order type: limit". I couldn't make sense of that.
I am deleting the sqlite file to be able to run freqtrade again. If I don't delete the sqlite file, freqtrade won't work.

There is no error when I use Limit order for buy, sell and stop

  * What did you expect to happen?

If there is no market order, sales cannot be made in sudden decreases. I would have expected that the market order would not cause the freqtrade to stop.

### Relevant code exceptions or logs

title: Backtesting should load pairlists after the strategy
body:
## Summary
Backtesting should load pairlists after the strategy to avoid running into problems if attributes needed in the pairlist are loaded from the strategy.

closes #3363 
closes #3463

## Quick changelog

- Load pairlist after strategy
- Explicitly fail if strategy-list is used in combination with PrecisionFilter.
- Explicitly fail loading PrecisionFilter if stoploss is not available (for test-pairlist ...)

title: Verify sell-rate returns a value.
body:
## Summary
Verify sell-rate got a value - otherwise downstream code does not work.

Using PricingException here will cease operation for this pair for this
iteration - postponing handling to the next iteration - where hopefully
a price is again present.

Closes #3347

## Quick changelog

- Verify if price is None, in which case, we raise PricingException and continue with the next pair.

title: Fix orderbook keyerror
body:
## Summary
In certain circumstances, orderbooks can be empty (for example RIGHT after an exchange outage - or on very shitty pairs where one side is empty).
currently, freqtrade is crashing hard on these with either KeyError or ExceptionError.

This PR adds handling for cases where the orderbook is empty on one (or both) sides.
It'll obviously only take effect when use_order_book is set to true.

Closes #3367 

## Quick changelog

- Introduce new errortype - `PricingError` to be clear what the cause for this error is.
- Handle key/IndexErrors when dealing with the orderbook.
- rename get_order_book to fetch_l2_order_book (to be aligned to ccxt).

title: WhiteList question Followed by an error
body:
Bittrex

Since some minutes (after a filled order), I have this message : 

`freqtrade.freqtradebot - INFO - No currency pair in active pair whitelist, but checking to sell open trades.`

What does it mean ? I've restarted but same message.

Found it :
`# Remove pairs for currently opened trades from the whitelist`

title: Stoploss on binance bug
body: when using limit stoploss on exchange on binance, the stoploss_on_exchange_limit_ratio isn't taken into account, and the order is created with a stoploss equal to limitprice.

title: FTX - Cancelled orders not being handled correctly
body:
Operating system: Ubuntu 20.04
Python Version: 3.8
CCXT version: 1.27.19
Branch: Master
Last Commit ID: 2a9653cd4e75819e22ff66b3d2ce3c7c5a4ca842
  
Describe the problem:

Orders that time out on buy are being correctly cancelled on the exchange, but are not being cancelled by FT and remain open.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Place buy order at bid price
  2. Wait for FT to timeout and cancel order
  3. Once order cancelled message is recieved on telegram, issue /status
  4. Order is still in list of open orders, but not found on exchange
  
Observed Results:

What happened?

- Timed out order was cancelled on exchange but still in open orders list in FT

What did you expect to happen?

- Timed out order removed from open orders list in FT

Relevant code exceptions or logs:

Log entries for the order cancellation:

```

title: Improve handling for buy order cancels
body:
## Summary
Improve logging to enable checking (via logs) which branch is taken when cancelling a buy order.
Also fixes #3130 - an exception caused by the cancel-order ['remaining'] field to be None (instead of not being present).

## Quick changelog

- Add logging statement for full buy order cancel
- Logging for the "partial" branch is available.
- Add `safe_value_fallback()` - a function to safely get a value out of 2 dictionaries where keys could exist, or be empty
- use safe_value_fallback to get remaining - the failing key
- Correctly catch InvalidOrderException should it occur from cancel_order (could happen if the order is filled that moment).

body:
Hi,

the following code coming from docs don't work :

```
    if self.dp.runmode in ('live', 'dry_run'):
        ob = self.dp.orderbook(metadata['pair'], 1)
        dataframe['best_bid'] = ob['bids'][0][0]
        dataframe['best_ask'] = ob['asks'][0][0]
```

because `self.dp.runmode` returns an enum `RunMode.LIVE` or `RunMode.DRY_RUN` and never 'live' or  'dry_run'

Maybe

```
from freqtrade.state import RunMode
   if self.dp.runmode in (RunMode.LIVE, RunMode.DRY_RUN):
        ob = self.dp.orderbook(metadata['pair'], 1)
        dataframe['best_bid'] = ob['bids'][0][0]
        dataframe['best_ask'] = ob['asks'][0][0]
```

not sur the more elegant way

Have a nice day

title: Bittrex Partially Filled Order Causes Fatal Exception

labels.name: Triage Needed
labels.description: Issues yet to verify

body:
## Step 1: Have you search for this issue before posting it?

If you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search our issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3Aissue). 
If it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

## Step 2: Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS 
  * Python Version: Python 3.6.9 (`python -V`)
  * CCXT version: ccxt==1.22.30 (`pip freeze | grep ccxt`)
  * Branch: Honeslty not sure. I use the setup -i to install, but I usually install the developer dependecies
  * Last Commit ID: b5ee4f17cb610cba273c2663112d6fe4f60154b9 (`git log --format="%H" -n 1`)
  
## Step 3: Describe the problem:
The bot crashes on a partially filled order using Bittrex. 

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Bot places order using ask price and 5min ticker
  2. The unfilled buy timeout is set for 15min
  3. Volume filter set for top 20 in quote volume
  4. Precision filter is set and with price filter set to low price ratio of 0.01
  
### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
 The bot has a fatal exception if the order is only partially filled after 15min. If I restart the bot, it assumes it filled 100% and will eventually try to sell the quantity but will fail because the quantity I own on the exchange is less than the quanity the bot is trying to sell. 

  * What did you expect to happen? 
I exepcted if an order is partially filled, the bot does not crash. Instead, it communicates to the exchange and updates the quantity in the bot/sqllite3 trades table with the actual partially filled quantity on the exchange. Allowing the bot to use it's exit strategy and stop loss. 

### Relevant code exceptions or logs:
```
2020-01-29 10:19:25,707 - freqtrade - ERROR - Fatal exception!
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/main.py", line 36, in main
    return_code = args['func'](args)
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/utils.py", line 58, in start_trading
    worker.run()
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/worker.py", line 71, in run
    state = self._worker(old_state=state)
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/worker.py", line 109, in _worker
    self._throttle(func=self._process, min_secs=throttle_secs)
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/worker.py", line 122, in _throttle
    result = func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/worker.py", line 132, in _process
    self.freqtrade.process()
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py", line 144, in process
    self.check_handle_timedout()
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py", line 802, in check_handle_timedout
    self.handle_timedout_limit_buy(trade, order)
  File "/root/freqtrade/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py", line 843, in handle_timedout_limit_buy
    trade.amount = order['amount'] - corder.get('remaining', order['remaining'])
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for -: 'float' and ‘NoneType'
```

title: Logs and Empty ticker history  when using dynamic pair list (binance)
body:
Hi,

When using dynamic pair list and when binance introduce a new pair i got this type of message :
```
2020-02-07 07:45:53,047 - freqtrade.exchange.common - WARNING - _async_get_candle_history() returned exception: "Could not load ticker history due to BadSymbol. Message: binance does not have market symbol BNT/USDT"
2020-02-07 07:45:53,047 - freqtrade.exchange.common - WARNING - Giving up retrying: _async_get_candle_history()
```

then

`2020-02-07 07:54:53,306 - freqtrade.exchange.exchange - WARNING - Async code raised an exception: TemporaryError`

and then

`2020-02-07 07:54:56,265 - freqtrade.strategy.interface - WARNING - Empty ticker history for pair BNT/USDT`


The problem is that warning comes a lot of time per minutes because of retries and after 3 weeks of run of my bot i have a beautiful log file of 2.3 Go :-)

I don't know what is the best to manage this maybe just the 
` WARNING - Empty ticker history for pair WRX/USDT` once per  `internals.heartbeat_interval`.

And i don't know if it should appear at warning level as it is not dangerous for trading money but just 'hello binance has find this market but have don't ticker yet'

Have a nice day.

title: bug in qtpylib max<->min
body:
a very simple bug.. the functions rolling_min/rolling_max are copies..

```
diff --git a/freqtrade/vendor/qtpylib/indicators.py b/freqtrade/vendor/qtpylib/indicators.py
index b3b2ac53..bef14039 100644
--- a/freqtrade/vendor/qtpylib/indicators.py
+++ b/freqtrade/vendor/qtpylib/indicators.py
@@ -288,9 +288,9 @@ def rolling_min(series, window=14, min_periods=None):
 def rolling_max(series, window=14, min_periods=None):
     min_periods = window if min_periods is None else min_periods
     try:
-        return series.rolling(window=window, min_periods=min_periods).min()
+        return series.rolling(window=window, min_periods=min_periods).max()
     except Exception as e:  # noqa: F841
-        return pd.Series(series).rolling(window=window, min_periods=min_periods).min()
+        return pd.Series(series).rolling(window=window, min_periods=min_periods).max()
```

title: Fix bad bug in safe_sell_amount
body:
## Summary
We MUST compare selling amount to wallet amount with >= (not >) - otherwise regular trades without "dust" are unable to be sold.

supports #2770

## Quick changelog

- Fix bug
- add test

title: Wrong usage of bids and asks from orderbook during sell
body:
If `use_order_book` is set to True in the `ask_strategy`, the `handle_trade()` implements its own way to calculate sell_rate -- it uses asks from the orderbook:

https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/blob/aa335d8485cb7099fd5a084f685babd3f4b4d1dd/freqtrade/freqtradebot.py#L606-L626

else it calls `get_sell_rate()`, which also has a branch for calculating sell_rate when `use_order_book` is set to True -- using bid prices from either orderbook or from the ticker. However, this is not used, since `handle_trade()` calculates sell_rate by itself using ask prices. This price (calculated using asks) is then passed to `_check_and_execute_sell()`. The latter passes this sell_rate to `should_sell` and `execute_sell`. The latter finally calls `_notify_sell`. The latter calls `get_sell_rate()` again, which in this case has a chance to calculate the sell rate using bids, so the bid price is reported. In the same time, all logic in `should_sell` and `execute_sell` used the price calculated by `handle_trade` using ask prices.

In my opinion, the logic for defining sell_rate using asks should be imployed (moved, merged somehow) into the generic `get_sell_rate`. Even better, both bid price and ask prices should be fetched from either the ticker or the orderbook and passed to `should_sell` and `execute_sell` -- because it depends on the type of sell order, will it be a sell market (when bids should be used) order or a sell limit order (when asks should be used). Corresponding price (bid or ask, depending on a type of the sell order, market or limit, whether it's sell signal, roi or stoploss, the types may differ) should be used in all calculations inside `should_sell()`, in `stoploss_reached()` and `min_roi_reached()`, same should be reported in `_notify_sell()`

The explicit bug consists now in that `should_sell` logic uses ask prices and `_notify_sell` then reports bid price from the orderbook.

title: Trailing stop hyperopt invalid results

labels.name: Hyperopt
labels.description: Hyperopt related issues and pull requests

body:
##  Describe your environment

  * Operating system: linux
  * Python Version: 3.7.5
  * Branch:  Develop
  * Last Commit ID: 8dd9b5c6fba973b98defc0f9a9e2e3c01af735dd
  
## Describe the problem:

Depending on the strategy, hyperopt may produce invalid results.

My trailing hyperopt just returned the following result.
However, configuring trailing_stop_positive > trailing_stop_positive_offset is not possible (we prevent this as part of config validation).

```
Stoploss:
{'stoploss': -0.34474}
Trailing stop:
{   'trailing_only_offset_is_reached': True,
    'trailing_stop': True,
    'trailing_stop_positive': 0.33186,
    'trailing_stop_positive_offset': 0.0542
}

```

Leaving out the irrationally high numbers my stoplosses reach... this configuration results in `The config trailing_stop_positive_offset needs to be greater than trailing_stop_positive in your config.` (also shown on slack).

### Further thoughts

Now i'm not 100% certain if the error is with hyperopt thinking about it.

The current validation we have in place ensures that "positive stoploss" cannot lead back into negative values. (5% offset and trailing_stop_positive at 10% could be a -5% sell).
However, I think it might be a valid case to say that a stoploss is -10% initially, and once the trade reaches 2% profit, it should be pulled tighter - to 5%. 
This could lead to -3% loss - but on the other hand it is not 10% loss anymore.

title: Fix UTC handling of timestamp() conversation in fetch_my_trades
body:
## Summary
trade.open_date and trade.close_date are in UTC timezone. After querying from the database, we get them as tz-native objects back - so calling `.timestamp()` on them results in different results depending on the timezone.
For UTC+ offsets this is not a problem, since we get trades for the last X hours - however UTC- offsets (Americas ...) will encounter update poblems as the "since" parameter sent to the exchange is in the future.

We can easily fix this by replacing the timezone with the utc-timezone (we don't convert to timestamp very often).

Closes #2490

## Quick changelog

- check all occurences of `.timestamp()`
- fix bug
- Align usages of timezone.utc (no need to use both timezone.utc and pytz.UTC)
- Test (for some reason my pc think's it's in Americas - and i'm not ...)

Lately I've had issues with running hyperopts for over 1 month+ or backtesting with multiple strategies for a longer period of time. It would eventually crash with the memory error: `MemoryError: Unable to allocate array with shape (5, 52704) and data type float64`. Upgradeing from the 32-bit version to the 64-bit version made it a lot better. I can backtest for over a year with many strategies. However hyperopting over 150+ days still seem to crash at about 500+ epochs for me. Usually when it tends to go for trades amount > 10k+.

When it crashes I'm left with no information 
![hyperopt](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24569139/68069843-30e02c00-fd66-11e9-9211-21016a2c5699.png)

I would love to see a feature that saves the settings from each result that gets printed in this terminal. For example everytime it shows you it made an improvement, it writes it with the settings to a txt file. It's important that it does it while it's in the process and not when it's done. Otherwise when it crashes you're still left with nothing. This way when it crashes I can still see it's output in a txt file.
I could also use `--continue` (which currently doesn't work), but then it will probably go into the same loop where it crashed due to the many trades amount, and I will be left with none optimized output settings.

Reason for these suggestions is because hyperopting takes a long time and is a very intense process, when I'm hyperopting I can't use my PC for anything else (well.. it's very slow). With these things added it would save a lot of time and hyperopting :). 

### Steps to reproduce:

title: Fix scoped_session and add Documentation for strategy

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: Enhancements to the bot. Get lower priority than bugs by default.

labels.name: Documentation
labels.description: Requires updates to documentation

body:
## Summary
`scoped_session` from sqlalchemy is a powerfull construct, allowing thread-safe handling of Sqlalchemy objects **if done correctly**.

freqtrade did not - initializing an explicit session and assigning this to `Trade.session` - breaking the scoped-session thread-safe functionality.
This caused problems like #1986 - which effectively is a race-condition (coincidental flushing of both the main and Telegram thread).

Closes #1986
closes #1753

## Quick changelog

- Introduce `Trade.get_trades()`
- Fix `scoped_session` handling
- extract SQL handling from rpc module
- Add documentation for the new query methods (#closes 1753)

title: Errorneous handling of active_pair_whitelist
body:
`Freqtradebot._active_pair_whitelist` is changed in the `process()` method while throttling: first it obtains the content of the whitelist config setting or a dynamic pairlist, then the list can be adjusted by the Edge, then it's extended with the list of pairs from the open trades.

It's okay for the trading logic, which is run in the same thread. However, it's accessed in the rpc modules as well, that typically run in different threads (for api server and telegram at least), so fetching of its value is performed independently of the transformations described above. As a result, two subsequent calls to `_rpc_whitelist()` may report completely different results: either the list from the config, or one after Edge, or one extended with trades.

All transformations of the active_pair_list in freqtradebot should be done using either local vars or another intermediate attribute, and active_pair_list should only get the resulting list after all transformations.

Btw, it's actually not active pair whitelist, but active pair list (maybe renamed during fix of this issue, to reflect its content more precisely).

title: WARNING: Unable to sell trade: Insufficient funds to create limit sell order on market
body:
## Describe your environment

  * Operating system: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
  * Python Version: Python 3.6.8
  * CCXT version: ccxt==1.18.1208
  * Branch: Develop
  * Last Commit ID: 06ab51b53d9c7b5bc43e0cdd03d704376aa71c26
  
## Describe the problem:

Sometimes a buy fails for the total amount, due to a timeout, for example:

Binance: Buying OMG/BTC
at rate 0.00009590
(0.050000 BTC,362.484 EUR)

A bit later:
Status: Remaining buy order for OMG/BTC cancelled due to timeout

A portion is bought, but in the database (trades) the total amount is written.

Trade ID: 26 (since 35 minutes ago)
Current Pair: OMG/BTC
Amount: 235.17 (0.0225528 BTC)
Open Rate: 0.00009590
Current Rate: 0.00009590
Current Profit: -0.20%
Stoploss: 0.00007193 (-25.00%)

The real amount bought in Binance is 234.93

So when it want to sell the items, there areinsufficient funds on Binance... Resulting in these kind of errors:

Unable to sell trade: Insufficient funds to create limit sell order on market OMG/BTC.Tried to sell amount 235.17 at rate xxx.Message: binance Account has insufficient...

### Observed Results:

  * What happened?
See Above

  * What did you expect to happen?
I expect that the trades table contains the updated amount of bought coins after a timeout to reflect the real amount so a sell cannot fail. (resulting in losses)

title: List-timeframes validates whitelist and load markets
body:
The `list-timeframes` command, when used with `--exchange` command (i.e. when used for exchange which is different from one, specified in the config) performs all the checks, that are needed for trading (validates whitelist, for example), loads markets (which also can fail for some exchanges) -- does many things that are needed for trading, but is redundant for the utility subcommands.

```
